description:
I've ordered from Kama via GrubHub several times now. They're 1) always on time, if not early; and 2) reliably delicious.

I've never been here in person, but from a delivery standpoint, they're excellent.
author: Evan M.

description:
Great happy hour! Yummy walu nigiri. Friendly staff.  Fast service. Good prices. 

This updated review is long overdue. I eat at Kama like once a week. It's a local Noe Valley favorite restaurant for me. The review I left years ago was with former owner/management, I wish I could delete it.
author: Sandy M.

description:
Great neighborhood spot for dinner, but food is hit or miss depending on what you order. 

We came here on a Sunday night and it wasn't very packed. The place is small so if you're a large party, it might be hard to get a table.

We ordered a miso soup and gyoza as starters. It was okay. Nothing to write home about. The gyoza did come with 6 pieces instead of 5, but the pieces were smaller. It had a nice crisp to the bottom and the top was soft. As soon as you bit into it, it fell apart. The filling didn't have much flavor.

For mains we ordered an assorted 7 piece sashimi, the August 4th roll, and the Red Dragon Roll. The assorted sashimi was good. The cuts were well prepared. I'm a little surprised that there was no salmon among the sashimi, but since it was chef's choice, no complaints. It was also interesting to try the different kinds of fish, some were super fatty and  melted in your mouth. 

The rolls were very unimpressive. The August 4th roll was lack of better words confused. The inside had unagi, avocado and tamago. It didn't pair very well with each other and the tamago didn't add much either. It was topped with "torched" salmon, but ours barely had any singe so it lacked the smokey burnt flavor. The Red Dragon Roll was forgettable. The spicy tuna was very spicy, but the texture of the whole roll was mushy. This roll was also supposed to be topped with "torced" tuna, but it was barely singed.

I live very close to here so I will most likely be back. I'll skip the rolls for now and just stick to their sashimi. Maybe I'll try their hot food next time too.
author: Junella T.

description: SLOWEST effing place ever...I ordered literally TWO things to go (skewers) and they took freaking THIRTY minutes ... Place was half empty. What the actual f**k??? Cancelled my order and got my money back and left... Hungry. Is there a ZERO STAR rating?
author: Vlad R.

description:
I just ordered the delivery from here. The biggest difference from other delivery that I can say is "the food is still hot like it came here at my door right after they made it." I was going to wait for my mate so that we could eat together, but I couldn't resist the look of delicious hot Katsu don! (Sorry mate..) 

Most of the time when I get katsu don delivered, the rice is little dried and the meat is cold. The ratio of the portions of rice and katsu are kind of off. (too much rice and a flat thin meat ) The saltiness of the sauce  was little too much for me. And as it said in menu it's really only Katsu and rice, nothing more. 
Overall I Personally do not hate this kind of katsu don, but i don't think I will recommend to another person.

However, this katsudon I got from here was totally opposite from what I usually get from other places. It was hot and moist. The ratio of the portion is good. Not too salty. And there's extra like mushroom, onion, green onion, and egg which were very enjoyable. 

(It wasn't crunchy but I guess that's too much to ask for since it's in the plastic Togo box.) 

It was the best katsudon I ever had from delivery in Bay Area.
author: Anna R.

description: The food is generally pretty good especially for delivery, but the restaurant is consistently late in delivering the food.  When you call them they always are apologetic because they had a busy night or too many orders, but I wish they would give more realistic windows then.  Tonight I ordered 6:47 pm, window given was 7:45-755 pm, food didn't show up until 8:15.  Other nights the wait's been even longer.  The food is good, just be prepared to wait.
author: Vivian W.

description:
The sushi here seemed fresh and good quality.  We had a few nigiri's- tuna, yellowtail, scallop, king salmon..  they were delicious and fresh.  We also had the real crab California rolls which I found to be significantly overpriced.

Unfortunately the hot food was not good, at all.  The miso soup tasted like water with no flavor and an odd color.  The chicken teriyaki was not made with fresh chicken which gave it a super unnatural chewy texture that was an immediate turn off.  The rib eye beef skewer was served rare and if it had been a good quality cut they could get away with it.  But it wasn't and it was a rare bloody mess I sent back.

The staff was nice, the space small and relatively clean.  With all the other sushi options in SF I will not be going back.  It's average at best
author: Samantha B.

description: This place rocks, the service was very quick, and the food was delicious. I highly recommend the dynamite balls!
author: Joel S.

description:
The fish here are not fresh, they smell fishy. The Butabara-Skewers (Pork Belly Skewers) is one of the worst item to choose from the menu. The temperature of the Pork Belly (Butabara) Skewers was not warm enough, the texture is dry and hard. This is by far the WORST Pork Belly Skewers I've ever eaten in my entire life.

The space in this restaurant is small, all tables are close to the main door and it could feel cold when people open/close the door.

Really not worth it to come and spend your money here.
author: Irene X.

description: Great fresh sushi with awesome service! Easy parking and the service is always perfect. We walked in and were offered nice seats by the window, our sake and beer came out fast as did our initial order. I'll definitely be back!
author: Jeff W.

description: We were craving some sushi one Saturday afternoon and decided to check this place out since it's walking distance from our place. We showed up unannounced and were still able to get a table since it wasn't very crowded. We tried the Poki as an appetizer and it was very oniony (if that's even a word). From the 5 rolls we tried I think my favorite was the Unagi Avocado roll and the Hot Mama. Spicy Tuna and Spicy Salmon were truly spicy and nothing really special so eat at your own risk! Their happy hour specials are good (we got some giant bottles of Sapporo for $5 each). Overall, pretty good place in the neighborhood if you know which rolls to get and pretty average if you don't. The price point is also awesome!
author: Berke T.

description:
Kama is, in my opinion, some of the best sushi I have had in SF for the price. A and I have been meaning to try this place since we moved to the neighborhood and, after 6 months, finally did. We were pretty hungry so we ordered a whole mish mash of items. As other reviewers have mentioned, going during Happy Hour is the time to go from 5:00pm-6:30pm (maybe that timing is incorrect) which is every day. There are both drink and food specials. Since it was New Years Day and we had plenty of fun the night before, we just took advantage of the food deals. We were served complimentary Edamame when we sat down which was a nice touch. We also ordered tea which was delicious and nutty. It really hit the spot for our sore throats. We ordered:

- Miso Soup ($1.95): I ordered one cup and A's meal came with it. This was good, standard Miso Soup. Don't expect anything mind blowing but its good.

-Gyoza ($5 during HH): Delicious and a good portion for 2. Next time, I would get them steamed because they were a little oily for my taste but they were quite good.

-Fujiyama Roll ($12.95)-Light and delicious. You could really taste the food and there wasn't any ingredients that were overpowering. Highly recommend.

-Saba and Shrio Maguro Nigiri ($4 each for 2 pieces during HH): Fresh and quality fish for a good price. Usually, I am disappointed by the fish quality or portion at other sushi spots but this was the perfect portion and quality at a fair price. Is it the best you will ever have? Probably not, but at the price point, it can't be beat.

-Beef Teriyaki Set Dinner ($13)-A ordered this and liked it. The Beef Teriyaki was good but a bit tough. Next time, A said he would probably stick with Sushi.

A was still hungry after dinner and after seeing the Mochi that another table had ordered, he wanted to get it as well. He ate almost all of it since I'm not really into Mochi. It came with 3 kinds of Mochi (I believe green tea, peach and strawberry) and each was topped with whipped cream and chocolate sauce. He was really happy with it.

For the two of us for all of this food, it was only $55 or so before tip which is definitely reasonable. The service was fast and the food was quality. If you're in the neighborhood, I would definitely recommend coming here for a light, possibly healthy dinner. Please note that they open at 5, unfortunately, so there is no lunch service.
author: Carrie W.

description:
Just don't bother coming here.
The fish is pretty bad and so was the rice. I'm not sure why I ever bothered eating here in the first place?

We ordered salmon, and hamachi to start.
Then decided we would go home and grab a pizza.
author: Alui L.

description:
I've been here a few times, usually on weekday evenings. It's a very small, intimate restaurant that seats about 20 people maximum. The walls are berry colored with fake trees and branches suspended on the walls.

They close at 9:30 but stop taking orders about 9:20, fyi.

Of the rolls I've tried, I love the golden dragon, C27 and crunchy scallop roll. The tempura is always super hot, light and crispy. The miso soup can be a bit watery in miso flavor but is packed with seaweed, chives and tofu.

The prices are moderate. We ordered 2 miso soups, mixed tempura, a rainbow roll, C27 and golden dragon rolls for about $57 before tip. 

Everyone is friendly and polite. I'd recommend this spot if you're nearby. Street parking is rough but manageable.
author: Taylor G.

description: I'm shocked this place doesn't have 5 stars on here. Been going here every month for 4 years and haven't had a bad meal yet. Their 49er roll is fantastic and the firecracker balls are unique and delicious. Love having them in the neighborhood.
author: Josh L.

description: Love this place! I come here pretty frequently because I live nearby. Fast service, friendly staff, and not expensive. Sushi is above average in quality, not the best I've ever had. There's also a lot of non-sushi items on the menu, which are also tasty.
author: Adrian M.

description: Quick service. Good for when you need a spontaneous sushi fix.
author: Yad L.

description: Really delicious food- we went at happy hour. Really great service. I ordered Harame and negi hamachi and an order of the fried chicken appetizer. Everything was spot on!
author: Lisa Y.

description:
2.5 stars.

I have had Kama a few times and it's been consistently mediocre. I generally order the deluxe chirashi and a few different kinds of nigiri. The deluxe chirashi has an impressive spread in terms of type of fish, including everything from uni and amaebi to salmon and mackerel. However, the fish is actually not particularly fresh. It's acceptable and won't get you sick but doesn't really meet my expectations.

The best nigiri here are the hotate (scallop) and amaebi (sweet shrimp). Both are not particularly impressive but still had a good slightly sweet taste at least. The uni, on the other hand, was terrible every single time. I never learned my lesson and kept ordering it because I love uni and wanted to give it another chance each time I was back, but the uni here is terrible. It's mushy and slimy and has a weird taste, not the delicate sweet brininess of good uni.

I also tried the green tea Japanese cheesecake, which was surprisingly tasty! It doesn't have very much crust but the cheesecake is smooth, creamy, and matcha-y. Definitely one of the highlights here. They only give a really tiny slice though.. :(

Overall, I would not come back here again. Not even sure why I've had Kama so many times already..
author: Tiffany P.

description:
Happy hour is a good deal. The promotion is from 5-7pm (I'm not pretty sure, but is around that time). Not the best sushi but it isn't bad.
Good option around the area during the happy hour. The prices were ok.
The service was good, the decoration is interesting, the simulation of trees and leaves make the place look different, it's small and cosy. I liked that it is quiet, so you can enjoy a good talk with the people you go with.
I would go back and try other options from the menu.
author: Bella C.

description: Probably some of the worst udon and ramen I've had in SF.  Can't speak to their sushi. Also menu descriptions and pictures are very inaccurate. Very disappointing!
author: Christina C.

description:
I order takeout through Yelp/Eat24 from Kama decently often. 

Sure, it's not knocking my socks off, but I've tried a few other places, and Kama has the most consistent order quality, so it's now where I order from when I want Japanese food without going out. The miso soup isn't my favorite, but is still warm when it shows up if you just need something warm in your tummy.  

They're also usually really quick to deliver: Eat24's confirmation email will say 45-60 minutes, but they're usually closer to 30 minutes (good to know if, like me, you submit your order on the way home). 

Tasty, fast, gets the job done.
author: Krista L.

description: Kama continually takes my order then waits right before I'm supposed to pickup or have it delivered and cancels my order. NEVER AGAIN. Shame on you Kama Sushi.
author: Brett R.

description: The combination of high quality fish and low prices at Kama is unbelievable. A neighborhood gem, Kama is one of the few sushi restaurants where you can leave feeling full without spending an arm and a leg. And the only restaurant I've seen that has happy hour on weekends as well as weeknights!
author: Munia P.

description:
I was having an epic sushi jones one Friday night and insisted it be addressed forthwith. The bf and I decided on KS, after stopping by another place that didn't smell very good and was loaded with childrens. No offense, I love kids, just not after 8 p.m. on a Friday night. That's adult time. 

When we arrived, the restaurant was half empty, but we were nevertheless told to wait at the bar, or had the option to sit at a pretty tiny and awful table in the corner. Hm, okay, we decided to wait at the bar. 

Much to our dismay, we were then sat at a tiny two-top right next to a family of 4 in the private booth. Look, I get how seating works--you want to save the bigger tables for bigger parties, but our table at KS was the worst and it detracted from our experience in a major way. We were especially unhappy that the better tables facing the windows remained empty all evening. 

The family we sat next to was super loud with screaming children who kept dropping things on the floor next to our table. Finally, they left and we were starting to relax when a dizzy tech couple were seated practically on our laps, despite a myriad of empty tables. I never do this, but ... WTF. We suffered at length listening to these two complain about minimal work problems. I hate listening to people complain about their jobs on my free time, or at all, really. 

I noticed that most of the activity in KS consisted of to-go orders, which clearly makes sense, in retrospect. 

Our sushi wasn't bad, but it was certainly not good enough to make up for the seating situation. Our server screwed up our order a bit, but it was just a misunderstanding, I think. We really enjoyed the kurobuta skewers and the hot sake, courtesy of Yelp. 

With so many sushi options in this city, I think KS def has room for improvement. I think order to go.
author: Sunny S.

description: Kama Sushi is kind of average to sub average tasting, and a bit too expensive for overlooking that for cheap sushi. I think they delivered quick & smoothly if I remember right, but underwhelming.
author: Christian L.

description:
2.5 STARS 

When I need to be cheap...I can be c-h-e-a-p. 

Just over the weekend, I got into it with a manager at an Asian market over $2. The staff mislabeled the price for coconut water. I told her it was the law and that they need to charge customers the posted price which was lower than scanned price. She refused, claiming that a kid switched the price tag. 

Mr. NSS: "Please don't make a scene, I'll pay for it."
Me: "Ummm no, it's the phuckin' law!"

Mr. NSS: "Calm down, you're getting your granny panties ALL up in a bunch over $2 BUT you spent $360 for one meal at Saison?!?" 
Me:  "Hey, I love my granny panties dammit...have fun with PALMela tonight!"

Choose your battles wisely, fellas. If you're girl wants to haggle over $2 so let it be. 

What drew me to Kama Sushi was their Happy Hour (HH) Specials available every day from 5 pm - 6:30 pm: http://bit.ly/10sysXZ. On the menu are $5 large hot sake, $4 large beers, $5 hot apps, $4 nigiri, and $5 maki rolls. I compared it the regular menu and you save about $1 for most items. Make sure to check in on Yelp for a free small hot sake!

I had a not so great experience at Kama's SoMa location aka mad Hershey squirts afterwards, however, I heard that their Noe Valley location was better. 

LIES.

If you're looking for solid and authentic sushi, you will not find it any of their Kama locations. As the infamous Nobu K. would say, it's 100% Chinese here (I'm 3/4ths Chinese and I heard the sushi chefs speaking in Canto) with a huge jive ass roll selection. Not to say, Chinese sushi is entirely bad because Hamano Sushi nearby does Chinese sushi right: http://www.yelp.com/biz/hamano-sushi-san-francisco.  Sakesan Bistro in Inner Richmond is also great as is Kamu Sushi and Amami Sushi in the Peninsula. 

We came right when Kama opened and we were the only ones there until we left. 

OUR ORDER:
*Soft Shell Crab (HH $5): http://bit.ly/1z2vFky
*Shrimp Tempura (Reg $7.95): http://bit.ly/1tgXqR0
*Yakitori: Kurobuta: Sausage & Butabura: Pork Belly (HH $5 each): http://bit.ly/1x6Xbj4
*Albacore Tataki (HH $7): http://bit.ly/1s9Jmsl
*HH CA Roll, Sake, Maguro, Saba ($5, $4, $4, $4) & Sake Toro & Hamachi Toro (Reg. $5.95, $7.95): http://bit.ly/1z2wj1E

What Kama excels in is their fried items. Whoever their chef is, they have excellent frying technique. The soft shell crab was piping hot, uber crunchy, and not greasy. Equally delicious was their shrimp tempura which was light, airy, and deliciously crunchy. One of the best shrimp tempura I've ever had! 

You can skip their yakitori skewers. The kurobuta sausage was store bought and decent enough but their pork belly thinly dry, overcooked, and insanely salty. 

With Kama's sushi, expect mediocrity. Thank goodness most of the nigiri we ordered was off the HH menu because I would NOT pay full price for these items here. We also ordered two nigiri off the regular menu to gauge the sushi making skills. 

One of the fundamentals of solid sushi is the shari (sushi rice) and Kama's shari was terrible. The rice was grossly overcooked, mushy, and underseasoned. It reminded of the shari in Safeway sushi. The fish to shari ratio was also off (too much rice). Additionally, the quality of the fish was subpar and not fresh. Even with the Sake and Hamachi Toro Nigiri from the regular menu, the fish tasted dull and stale; no butteryness whatsoever. Avoid the Saba, it was fishier than p.....never mind. As a comparison, the sushi here is a baby step higher than sushi found at an Asian buffet. 

Wasn't fond of the service either. Our male server was curt. After we received our food, he left to use his phone and never came back. The female server seemed friendly and brought us our bill. Had she been our server, this would have been a solid 3 star place. 

Kama is small compared to their SoMa location with seating for about 25 people. We usually sit at the sushi bar but it was very dim so we opted for window seats for some natural light. 

Easy street parking.

While this reads to be more of a 2 star review, I'm giving them 2.5 stars rounded up because of the HH specials and no mad Hershey squirts afterwards.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: Back to being pretty good again. Not sure what happened, maybe some turn over in the staff bc I don't see the same folks working here as when it first opened. Anyway, after a 1/2 of decline they are back to being a neighborhood staple.
author: Adrian F.

description:
Food is excellent and the service is
Good.

Their menu layout is interesting 

I enjoy their dinners-even though there are only three dinners listed on their menu.

Most of what is on the menu is more of  an al la Carte.
author: Alexander M.

description: Love this place. So close to home (5 minute walk). When we first entered this place, we were immediately seated by the very kind staff. The inside of this restaurant is very cozy and modern. The waitress was also very quick to take our order. I ordered the sashimi chef choice (7piece) and it was pretty fresh, but not the freshest I've ever had. Then we ordered the red dragon and rainbow roll. Both were delicious. To top off the meal, we ordered the hot sake to cleanse our palette. Overall, great experience and will come back since I am the DUKE of this place ;)
author: Ricardo R.

description: Average food and ambience. Fine for a go-to weekday takeout, but not a place for anything memorable.
author: R M.

description:
I love the Miso Vinegar Dressing on the Greens salad. Perfect amount of dressing. Everything fresh. 
I've never had a better Spicy Salmon Roll. It was perfect~! The Rice, Flavors, everything Magnifique~! Why cant they all be like that? 
The Clam Miso was good. 
Good Wasabi, and the Ginger wow! I don't usually like The Ginger that comes with most sushi orders, just like I don't usually like Edamame, but it was complimentary so I had to try it! I happily ate both as they were both delicious! 
Great Customer Service~!
author: Adrienne A.

description:
Terrible service, we were the only people in the restaurant and the two waitresses were talking to one another rather than trying to give us a decent dining experience. They gave us all of our food we ordered simultaneously which made for a really chaotic dining experience.

The food was unfortunately worse than the service. We ordered the seafood salad and the chirashi, the fish tasted off to say the least. The food was simply not fresh. I've been to probably 100's of sushi restaurants and I can honestly say Kama Sushi was easily in the bottom 5% of sushi places I've been to in terms of the quality of food.

Oh yeah, and my hands smelled like rotten fish upon leaving. A very unpleasant experience overall.
author: Deck Hero T.

description:
A bit overpriced for decent quality food. Nothing was a standout but, at the same time, nothing great. 

A perk is that they deliver.
author: Julie L.

description:
FREE SAKE when you check in.  Also complementary edamame and it's pretty good.  

Okay so my friends went ham and usually I do too but my stomach wasn't having any of it.  I stuck with the Golden Dragon roll, which by the was was good but not the best roll I've had, and a spring mix salad.  I actually really liked the salad.
author: Lydia K.

description: A fabulous local spot! Delicious sushi, super friendly service and great ambiance. Their hamachi kama is superb as are all their "cold appetizers." They also have fantastic udon if you're looking for something hot. All around delightful.
author: Kirsten S.

description:
I really like this place great sushi, fish is so fresh that you can literally think that they just pulled out the water, it's a bit expensive? yes it is.. although portions are generous so that's something..!

Also the waiters are such nice people I receive a great attention and my family and I felt cared that's very important to us, also food presentation is a complete A we like our food to look good, otherwise we don't even think about eating it.
author: Whythny M.

description: Love their happy hours a lot!!! the quality of the food is defiantly more valuable than its price, but the space is pretty limited, not suitable for big group !
author: Cui Larm C.

description:
So so so so rude. Awful. Awful. Awful. Awful. Don't ever go here. Period.
They are so rude. I came to noe for a salon.  Wanted some sushi between treatments. Awful service. Awful food.
author: Marie A.

description: I really want to love this place, but they can't seem to ever remember our whole order!  We've been here several times, and they always forget to bring edamame, or seaweed salad, or most recently - our entire order of Nigiri.  When they do remember to bring out the food, it's pretty good, and the staff is friendly, but I think we'll stick to visiting during the slow hours.
author: Riley D.

description:
my fave sushi spot in my hood... you can find me here every other week.. 
an inventive menu with very fresh fish at reasonable prices for my weekly sushi cravings.. 
Always treated well (like family..) with great service...
Eat here.
author: Rose C R.

description:
Used to order delivery from here all the time, always showed up yummy and before the delivery window even started. Unfortunately, on my last encounter this past weekend I don't think I'll be ordering their delivery again. Everything was soggy after sitting in the car for so long, the miso had spilled out and the skewers were cold. They were later on delivering and had smashed two roles into a box meant for one. Will be my last delivery from them. 

Food is much better in person, but since I have to walk a couple hills it requires more effort than ordering through Yelp (read: I'm lazy). I'll still go back but not as often as I would have gotten stuff delivered. In person you get free, albeit usually cold, edamame and everything tastes a little bit better.
author: Aida Z.

description: Great sushi for delivery. I am picky about my sushi and this place does not disappoint. I would stick to sushi only if you want delivery.
author: Juan V.

description: Great neighbor place. The sushi is fresh. Great specials at great prices during happy hour. Service is GREAT. Nice atmosphere. I recommend it for all to try!!!
author: Martin N.

description: Such yummy sushi with fair prices and good service. We will be back next time we are in the city. It's also nice because the restaurant is not in a touristy part of SF.
author: Halley W.

description:
I have been shopping for an affordable and great sushi restaurant in the city for a while and finally found it with Kama. 

The sushi tastes fresh and well prepared.  The staff is super friendly and go out of the way to serve with speed and smile.  There are busy times that sometimes prevents them to provide excellent service, but they try hard.  

I recommend this place if you ever are debating if you want sushi or SUSHI !!!!
author: Jimmy I.

description: I've been to so many sushi restaurants in the city, so far Kama Sushi is my favorite sushi restaurant with excellent services and outstanding quality. The sushi tastes very fresh and yummy. I highly recommend to give this sushi restaurant a try. :)
author: Rachel L.

description:
We stopped going there after a hostess (Meila?) refused to pack our a Happy Hour meal to go.  So she served us first instead and then throw some paper boxes later so we can pack.  We appreciate you follow your bosses protocol precisely.  However, you need to learn a bit of a customer service as well.  
Being a neighbor next door, we had visited the place once or twice per week on a regular basis.  Now we are going elsewhere.

You loose a local customers!
author: Alex R.

description: Came here for ramen and the best part about it was the fried chicken which was placed on a separate plate and was really really good. Yet, despite the chicken, I can't help but give Kama Sushi 2 stars being that their dish wasn't all that great. I WOULD add an extra half star for the free sake if I could but unfortunately...this is yelp. I would love to give this place another shot though and update this review.
author: Joshua F.

description:
Fish is PHRESH! Like nowhere I have been lately. Yes, phree edamame and surprisingly decent house nigori. However, the kanpcuchi nigiri was... "You have got to be kidding me!!!" In the middle of my review it was pointed out and then self witnessed that one of the sushi chefs had a bandaid over his  left forefinger without gloves! 2 stars down. Who does that? Who the "----" does that? Sadly lost a possibly very good customer. No, not possibly.  Did lose a good customer!!
Your call?!?
author: Jaynie F.

description:
shrimp roll was not good. ramen was not good. there was barely any miso soup in the container. 
very bad experience
author: Margaux S.

description:
Great, fresh sushi at reasonable prices!  Delivery is a hit or miss - not in terms of the food, but whether they will actually deliver your order.

For best results, dine at the restaurant.  Friendly service, great fish, delicious sashimi and rolls.
author: Michael D.

description:
Having come here fresh of my very recent visit to Tataki South, I had fairly high expectations of what i wanted to see out of the local competition here in the Noe Valley Area. 

*But also, today's visit is also in honor of the now-ended TV Series-  Kitchen Nightmares (R.I.P)....The show that taught millions of Yelpers and foodies what to expect out of a decent working kitchen but also put Yelp itself on the map world wide.

The first thing you notice about both locations share relatively the same amount of reviews give or take how ever many were filtered out by yelp's algorithms. And given that their avg rating was also relatively close, this should be the equivalent to watching a Patriots-Broncos Game during the Brady/Manning Era right?

Well ...as it turns out, it really depends what you're looking for.
Some people watch because fantasy football got them hooked on points.
Some people watch just to check out the cheerleaders 
But also some people watch to see men in tights....(i dont quite understand why)...but whichever side they're on, they're still there for something related to the sport.....

In terms of sushi quality based on todays presentation. I would have to admit, Kama Sushi does have some of my old favorites ranging from Golden Dragon/Dragon Roll as well as the typical rolls you would find on Geary Blvd in the Richmond district, but after reading what i saw at Tataki South. I went against my usual habits of ordering anything with Unagi in it....

I got lucky on both occasions; 
2 very visually appealing female waitresses at both individual locations.
2 Happy hour Menus that consisted of tasty delicacies and house specials.
2 Relatively similar Yelp Check in Deals.
2 Very easy locations in terms of finding parking...
.
But down to the rice, the rolls and the roll-outs..

1)The WHITE OUT ROLL:  features an all white fish seafood roll made to order at the sushi bar, delicately and evenly torched one at a time to produce an effect that only people trained in handling such techniques can do without turning the white out into a burnout. 

The resulting flavor is a very light fresh taste that you could only equate to if you have had fresh sashimi straight from the source, but if you're looking for a flavor you could actually taste this one isn't quite there yet, but it is still  very good choice for first time visitors who are not used to this kind of cuisine.
(Albacore, Avacado, Walu, Hamachi)

2)TUNA POKI Appetizer- Compared to most places, some locations would drench the tuna in sauce and very little seaweed and expect us to consume it right away. Others would forget the sauce and just load up on spices and nearly kill our throats if we forgot to order some accompanying drinks.

The tuna poki here is served with its seaweed garnish but also has a hidden hot kick to it for flavoring it. The knock in the nail for this serving is that there is more seaweed than there is tuna. that's as simple as i can explain it.

Overall Verdict: 

A)IF you're looking for something not too different from Geary Blvd type menu but higher quality items avaliable, go to Kama.....

B)IF you're looking for a fresh taste of the best ingredients locally sourced and sustainably grown/harvested and prefer an intimate setting with a concise selection that will impress.. I'd tip my hat to Tataki South...

Personal Verdict: I forgot to order a Coke.
author: Eric C.

description:
Great neighborhood sushi bar with an awesome happy hour daily 5-6.30pm.

Their daily specials are always good, and get a free sake for checking in with Yelp.  I love sashimi and they have many tasty choices that are super fresh.

Overall really good spot for some well priced, delicious sushi in Noe Valley.  Oh, and they deliver too!
author: George M.

description: Hella good food. Quality fish and unique rows. Hot papa is hella good. They have such a variety of rolls to choose from.
author: Johnny D.

description: The service is great, the are always very attentive. The sushi quality is great, especially the albacore tataki.
author: Laura H.

description: Rude. Unfriendly staff. Ordered online. They messed up my order (which I of course only checked when I got home). When I called I was told I'd have to come back. Delivery was not possible. The new order was out quick, but when I checked it I noticed that there was another error (missing avocado). I mentioned it to the server. Another server came over, I explained again & she rolled her eyes & said something in Japanese to her co-worker. At that point I thought "forget it". They lost my business. The sushi is only barely better than the sushi at Safeway. Not worth it.
author: Tamara V.

description: Ordered delivery from this place a few days ago.  The food left something to be desired.  Portions were tiny for the price.  I was left so hungry.
author: Gab C.

description:
Came here after a long ass day of walking all over the city with my best friend and we literally would've eaten whatever, but we were trying to be healthy after eating just chips. So, we were all like, sushi is healthy, right? 

Anyways. Even though this place has a pretty sizeable happy hour menu, you're better off just ordering a full roll off the regular menu if you're hungry. We ended up ordering a full spicy tuna roll, chicken karaage, spicy ramen, gyoza, and katsu don. Ramen was meh. Gyoza was standaard, but not bad. Spicy tuna roll was legit. The fish tasted fresh, which was good considering it was a weekend. Chicken karaage and katsu don was legit. Both the chicken and pork were cooked just right.

Everything was pretty affordable, and for all the food we got between two people, we spent $47. The bathroom was clean. This place is in a sweet spot in the hood, and wasn't overly crowded for a Sunday night. It'll make for a good staple, neighborhood sushi spot for me.
author: Shawn B.

description:
Alright option.

This sushi place is exactly what you need for a cost effective quick sit down place close by. 

The rolls are decent, but not amazing. 
The service is totally fine. 
The atmosphere is alright.
The price point is fair.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
So I ordered for delivery using DoorDash. Unfortunately, it was a very disappointing experience. I ordered the 24 piece sashimi combo and only got 18 pieces.  I paid $53 for their sashimi and only got 3/4 of what I was supposed to get. Also, their tuna just tasted off. It was bitter tasting.   Their sushi rice was also too vinegary.  Their seared fish rolls were hardly seared with a torch. It tasted like it was just boiled or steamed.  

I was not impressed and will not be ordering from them again.
author: Diana V.

description:
Happy hour is 5-6:30 daily. It was not crowded on a Monday night at 6pm but the place is very small (as most ramen restaurants are) so I imagine it could get crowded on any given night, especially later. Make reservations just in case. Could be a cute dinner date place - the interior design is charming and the restaurant faces west so there's a good amount of natural light before sundown. We also noticed a private table in one corner - dunno if you can reserve that but you could try :P

For HH, we took advantage of California rolls because my friend loves them ($5/6pc during happy hour compared to $6.50) and they did not disappoint. Just the right amounts of snow crab, avo, and rice!

What really made this place was the delicious ramen broth! Deeelicious. We had the tonkatsu ramen and the pork was very tender and cooked to perfection! One of us had the pork replaced with the fried chicken - also very good, but I would go for the classic tonkatsu if you are trying this place for the first time.

Service was friendly. There was a slight miscommunication on our orders, but they were apologetic enough afterwards. The people here are very nice. :)
author: Andrea V.

description: I've never actually eaten here, but I've ordered takeout from them several times. The garlic edamame is to die for. I've never tried the fancy rolls, but the simple maki and sushi is consistently fresh and tasty. Their delivery is always fast and courteous. It's not going to blow you away, but for a mid priced sushi joint it meets expectations.
author: Diana G.

description:
Ambience-This place is cozy; well decorated.  I have a thing about clean bathrooms, and this was one of the best maintained bathrooms I've seen (and they chose a cute faucet).  

Service- efficient.  While not overly friendly, they did everything I requested in a timely manner.  Our order came out quickly, which is always important because I have two impatient little boys and one "Hangry" Daddy.

Food-  yup, dragon roll tastes like the dragon roll like the sushi at any other sushi house.

The cozy ambience and efficiency is what sets them apart from all other sushi places.
author: Maria B.

description: A night out in town with some friends, I was hankering for some sushi. Looked up at yelp and found this place near by. I was not expecting much due to the ratings but after giving it a go, this place definitely deserves some credits. Other than the great service I received the food was delectable. Salmon has always been my favorite so I ordered the Sake Oyako Don. I can't get over how fresh the salmon tasted. Literally melts in my mouth and I was very satisfied. My friends ordered ramen and few rolls to share. We enjoyed every single bite. Don't hesitate to try this place. Staff was really friendly and the food blew me away. When I'm craving for sushi again, this place will definitely be on my list to go.
author: Alice H.

description:
I'm rating this place by their happy hour. Finding a good sushi happy hour in San Francisco is not the easiest thing to do. Especially finding a place that has good service where the waiter will return to check and see if you need to place any more orders multiple times. They always ensure that you order your last dishes before happy hour ends; this always makes me happy. 

I definitely recommend the tatakis here. Good quality food for decent prices.
author: Marlene T.

description: Great sushi and great chiefs here! Definitely my first sushi option in town. The sashimi is fresh and decent. The chasho lamen tastes good as well. Highly recommend and you would not regret eating here!! 美味しいね!
author: Karin M.

description:
happy hour is a great deal at this place. the best time 5:30-6:00. no need to wait for seat. the sushi is ok. the price is acceptable. the service it could make it better. 


overall, the place isn't bad. suggest to try in happy hour time
author: Li S.

description: Still a pleasure to come back to Kama. It's funny because I try n check other sushi bars out but I always end up coming back here. The stag always so nice and are very kid friendly since I usually always bring my 5 year old son. Kama I will see you again soon
author: Daniel V.

description: Attentive service. Charming neighborhood spot. Carpaccio is recommended. White out roll was also good. If they have the blue fin, get it. Not as good as Kiji, however. This place deserves a 4 star average.
author: Nico K.

description:
I've been ordering delivery from Kama Sushi frequently. Since their delivery food has never disappointed me., I finally came in the other night with my brother to dine in. The service was exceptional! The waiter had so much attention to detail and he was passionate, and knowledgable about sushi. 

The place was very busy at the moment and the food came a bit late, but it was definitely worth the wait. Extremely fresh and seasonal variety of fish. I will certainly be back to try more of what they have to offer, whether its dining in or taking out. THANK YOU KAMA SUSHI!
author: Natassia S.

description: Great service!! I was very happy with the specials they offered especially when food tastes that good! And who can turn down free SAKE ppl!! I had a great time. Cozy atmosphere and prices are well accordance with the portions and fresh taste. Very recommended enjoy!
author: Georgia T.

description: I wondered into this corner spot in the Noe Valley neighborhood of SF on a sleepy early evening during the week. Small corner spot ( I seem to find these alot) great happy hour menu ranging from sushi, tempura and a range of booze, I had a bottle of Niguri for $10.00. I went with the spicy miso ramen and it was good , broth wasn't to my standard and the noodles a bit over cooked.  Good size portion and the right price but I have to say left alot to be desired.  Maybe just hit the happy hour menu next time if there is a next time.
author: John K.

description:
The interior is decorated in an inviting modern motif.  The top third of the walls are bathed in green lighting with leafless, tree branches suspended in front of them.
The tableware is very nice--earthenware pieces I believe.

Too bad our waiter was aloof and diva-like.

It's not my fault that the tables are so packed together and that they sat us behind the  "long table". ( on your left as you enter the small restaurant).  The "long table" was filled with kids that could have cared less about the green bathed walls. It was time to wrestle each other as their hypnotized Noe Valley parents sat by and pretended to not notice.

Our waiter probably had a 27" waist and he was still unable to squeeze by to take our order.  Rather, he stood 2 tables away and leaned in while we repeated (shouted) ourselves 3 times--"albacore tataki, torikara skewers to start!!"  "We'll order something else after the appetizers!!".
  
The "something else" after the appetizers turned into Karaage Ramen--
[pork or soy sauce flavor ramen with deep fried chicken, corn, romaine lettuce, green onion, dry seaweed]
AND
The Hot Papa.  This is one of their signature rolls. 
[spicy tuna roll wrapped with scallop & cheese, baked with garlic sauce]

We also ordered a 5 piece sashimi plate of butter fish. (Walu)

The sashimi and ramen came out together and I sat and waited for the Hot Papa roll.
By the time it came out, my dinner companion had finished the ramen.  We shared the butter fish before the ramen was consumed.

The timing was way off--it's weird to be at a table and eat when someone else has already finished.

Pros:  the tataki, chicken skewers, butter fish and ramen were pretty good.
Cons: The Hot Papa was a Hot Mess--flavors were way off--yecch!
          The waiter was very nice as he gave us the bill--don't you hate that?
author: Thomas D.

description: I just got take-out from Kama in Noe and the cuts of sashimi are bad and the miso soup was a TINY portion (fills half a cup). I've had a much better experience at Kama sushi in SOMA.
author: Ruha D.

description:
Have been coming to this place for almost 4 years now, and it never dissapoints
the food is always consistent, and delicious
 the staff is super cool and quick, and the Main guy Roku is a awesome person that i always look forward to seeing while I'm there
HIGHLY recommend this Sushi spot
author: damian s.

description:
Free edamame was overcooked and served cold. Spicy hamachi was flavorful. 

Reason for one star: I ordered kara-age ramen, which tasted exactly like the 25 cent Maruchan ramen I used to eat in college. Only had a few bites. When we asked for the check, the waiter asked if there was something wrong with the food. I explained that it tasted terrible. Without an apology, the waiter said yes, they probably messed it up because they were so busy. They didn't make any adjustment to the bill or offer to bring something else.
author: David F.

description: Loved the Sashimi here with salmon of brilliant taste. I would recommend having calm soup there since the ingredients are really fresh. It's a small business so probably not good for a large group of people in 10 or more.
author: Wu J.

description:
This "restaurant" rating is 1/2 of a star. 
I GOT SICK! I GOT SICK! I GOT SICK!

SOUP: The to-go containers for soup are about an 1" inch deep, two sips and it's gone, tasteless, and not enough ($2 each)

POTSTICKERS: $7 will get you miniature versions of the real thing. It's so small, they all fit inside the palm of your hand (if you're a girl who weight 105lbs w small features). The inside is "filled" or was lightly sprinkled w a substance not recognizable due to lack of "it". Why bother sending me an item like this? (Sigh)

SUSHI: One of them I specifically asked to tempura and to add cream cheese ($4 extra charge) but instead received a burned "Twinkie", which was over cooked, and drenched in aoli sauce to disguise the black patches of the thick, burnt batter. The rest of the sushi looked descent because they were simple makis, as for taste, just slightly worse than the ones Wholefoods provide to-go. Perhaps it was the freshness, i doubt it was good fish, because it's 5 AM and my stomach is in knots. 

"SKEWERS": NO BIGGER THAN 3 cm each, for either chicken or beef (you get 2 skinny pieces of 1" inch long minute steaks for about $6 each order) 
My guy is 6'3 and ordered $12 worth of meat, but instead, got 4 children size skewers that literally got stuck in between his teeth before being able to enjoy it. He came hungry from work to find this, you should've seen his face w disappointment, we felt ripped off. Did you ran out of meat? Why would you charge so much for something that fits in between a TOOTHPICK? Why were they chewy? Why are they categorized under skewers, their own separate section, when they're merely "cold snacks"? Why the rip-off? 

DELIVERY: We're only two miles away and it took 70 minutes for food this tiny to arrive. All 8 to go items fit inside a medium size paper bag folded half way down, this is when I knew to expect everything to be very small, INDEED.

I'm so upset, my stomach is sick, my partner is mad. What a terrible night. What a terrible way to start the week. 

I had to get up and make food in my kitchen so that my partner could feel like he ate. Can you believe that? I had to COOK after we got everything we ordered because it WASN'T enough/good/worth eating.

My partner does not eat sushi but decided to try other items not to be left out, and perhaps try it for the first time. Instead, I further upset him about eating sushi AT ALL because I'm so sick. Thank u for that.

I relied on the four star ratings. I want my money back, I want my stomach to not remind me that you guys made me sick. I want this nightmare to be over, I want to sleep, DAMN YOU and your "food".

I have NEVER said anything negative about a restaurant on Yelp, but you guys went too far, and I hope nobody goes through this. We are NOT picky eaters, we just like to discover places to eat so that I don't have to slave in the kitchen for a change. 

Go to a different restaurant, if you're a health inspector, or know one, you should hint them at this place. 

Please feel free to call me, if you'd like to verify the validity of this review yourselves, or I can drive down to the restaurant and explain my experience, I am willing to do that for the sake of others. I'm sure you can remember me from when you guys called and asked if I REALLY wanted what I ordered (due to the extra cost for cream cheese and tempura) on that one burnt roll.
author: Joyce C.

description:
There's a neon sign on the outside of the restaurant that makes you feel like there's perpetually a police car outside, policing whatever white-collar crimes are going on in Noe Valley. We should have seen that and stayed away.

The food: I didn't come here to get authentic Japanese food, but I did at least want fresh fish. That I did not get. The fish from the sushi dinner looked visibly dull: it had obviously been around the block a few times. The tuna in the rolls tasted almost acrid; I'm not even sure how I would make something taste like that myself. My friend got the ramen (okay, she shouldn't have gotten ramen at any place other than a ramen shop, but she was craving it). Also not a great dish at all.

Service and cleanliness: this restaurant must be popular with kids who like throwing food, because to our left there was a family with two kids throwing food everywhere, and to our right there was an empty table with food scattered all over the table and on the floor, which didn't get cleaned up for the entire ~45 minutes that we were there. The staff didn't ask us if we wanted drinks or even offer us the drinks menu; that can't be good for business.

Overall I was disappointed by the experience, and I won't be coming back. There's authentic sushi and then there's good American-style rolls and fake sushi; they hit different spots for me and I can do either, but this one lacks the basic foundations of a pleasant restaurant.
author: Keito U.

description: Go during happy hour, which is EVERY DAY, to eat velvety good sashimi. Japanese quality at Chinese prices. ;)
author: Thad B.

description: I  came to Kama sushi for my 45th birthday, an intimate dinner with my fiancé. And to our expectation it was wonderful. We come here often, Thursdays are our regular days. We love the food and service. Their happy hour is great too! Highly recommend!
author: Tom W.

description: Nice cuts of sashimi, decent "Boston roll", decent deep fried soft shell crab.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Omg.....  

How did I NOT know this place sooner! Wow.... From the beginning to the last..!! 
Definitely one of my favorite place now.
Great decor, Great staff, Great foods! Can not go wrong! Yum, Yum, YUM

Must try Shrimp Kama, Hamachi Kama, Dragon Balls, Karaage, Ramen, and so much more! I'm looking forward to try some more stuff in the future. 

All the staff are so friendly and attentive. 120% satisfied! Thank you for the great experience everyone at Kama Sushi! You guys are awesome! 

Can't wait to go back!!
author: savvi d.

description: Kama sushi is great. If your looking for a great sushi fix and a nice place to sit down and enjoy your food, your in the right place. I got a deep fried spicy tuna roll (I forget the name). It was simple but delicious. Perfect for families and couples.
author: Veronica Y.

description:
Pretty dependable as far as your standard San Francisco non-Japanese sushi goes. And happy hour has some pretty good deals. Just don't expect top quality fish or sushi rice. 

If you like crazy mixed up rolls this might be the place for you. 

Service was fairly prompt without being overly rude. 

Three stars is about right.
author: Victoria W.

description:
Sushi is great.  Haven't had a roll i didnt like yet.  THe employees provide great service.    In Noe valley its the only place to get Ramen next to me, and its pretty tasty, although there are not too many options.  
Fave rolls:
Golden dragon
Grill Toro roll
Pyramid
Autumn
Hot mama
author: Matt W.

description:
3.5 Stars Review.

Got the Yelp deal $10 for $20 and decided to give it a try,

We got there on a Friday around 8:00pm. Be aware, it was kinda tough to find parking in this neighborhood.  We spent almost 20 minutes to look for a street parking.  

Good that we only waited 10 minutes for a table.  They have the check-in offer on Yelp, so make sure to check in and get the free small sake.  

The service was kinda slow but everyone was very friendly there.  They refilled our water quite often.

The menu was extensive.  It took me quite a bit to look through the whole menu.  

We have ordered:

Grilled Seabass (4/5) - The seabass was very good.  It tasted rich and flavorful, but the portion was pretty small for what you paid.  

Crunchy Lobster (3/5) - It was lobster avocado rolls with the topping of crunchy flakes.  This roll was recommended by the server.  It was ok.  The roll was pretty small.

Super Dynamite (3/5) - It was tempura spicy tuna rolls.  The roll was ok.

Shiitake (Mushroom) Roll (4/5) - This one was an easy roll, so nothing special. But the taste was little different from other Japanese restaurants

White Butter Fish Roll (Forgot the name)  (2/5) - This one was not good.  It was white butter fish over the CA rolls.  The white butter fish was not fresh.  They used the faked crab meat for the CA rolls.  The roll was very small.  

Overall Kama Sushi do have some creative sushi rolls and special dish but the quality of the food was not consistent.  Also I think the staffs need to know the menu more.  It seemed like they don't have any knowledge of what sushi was actually about.
author: Liza T.

description: Solid neighborhood sushi joint. It's not Nobu...but it almost never disappoints either. Fish is always fresh and the sashimi is always cut thick. Great value for money.
author: C X.

description:
Made it to Kama in time for Happy Hour (daily from 5:00-6:30pm). The prices are fairly decent, but really, you get what you pay for. They offer two-piece nigiri rolls for $3.50 and six-piece maki rolls for $5. Of course it doesn't include every fish in the sea, but it's a solid deal. I opted for the two-piece sake (salmon) nigiri and it was delicious. The unagi/avocado maki roll was just OK.

I also opted for the rainbow roll (snow crab and avocado roll topped with tuna, salmon, shrimp, yellowtail, and snapper), which tasted like an unfortunate California Roll, but at least the fish atop the roll was fresh. 

The Crunchy Lobster is a mess of a roll. It's supposed to be a roll with lobster salad and cucumber topped with salmon, avocado, crunchy flakes, and tobiko. Instead, it's a plate that's littered with crunchy flakes (deep-fried panko pieces, it seems) and you have to dig around to locate the roll. (Jina R.'s photo perfectly represents it: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kama-sushi-san-francisco-6?select=tnboAedKImRyRlM6TDUWZQ#WCZKg65tKPo0oVvQZo745g) When you find it, though, it's far creamier than any roll should be. Um, no thanks.

I hear the ramen's pretty tasty, but (as much as I loves me my ramen), I'm not sure if I'm willing to come back.

Pro-tips:
+Unless you're into the mayo-ridden rolls, stick to the simple ones. 
+Happy Hour is worth the trip, but don't expect greatness.
+Free shot of sake with a Yelp check-in.
author: Adena B.

description:
I was once a regular here **NOT FRESH Anymore***

After going back twice, just to make sure, and it was awful. The Hamachi nigiri was rotten and fishy. They are not doing quality check on what they serve.

As for rolls they were pretty awful as well. They use the sauce to mask the older fish (a trick cheap sushi places use). And they lie about the ingredients, they left out the 'real' crab and put in imitation crab. They swore it was the real thing but real crab isn't bright red!!

AVOID - Trust me
author: Mr. M.

description:
I went here with a group of five on a Friday night. We called ahead to make sure they had room for us and arrived about 30 minutes later. 

The sushi here was very good. We split a few rolls as well as some sashimi and a magnum of nigori (which isn't on the menu but totally worth it if you have a large group). The rolls that we tried were great - Autumn, C27, and Foxy. I definitely want to try the vegetable gyoza next time. Also, a small dish of edamame comes free when you sit down. 

The only negative was that our waitress (while very nice) was a little unsure about some of the menu items, and additionally we waited a long time in between rolls and then an additional long time for our check. It is a small restaurant and it wasn't packed, so we weren't sure why the check especially took so long. 

Everything that we had was very delicious and I will definitely go back to try some more of the interesting rolls.
author: Laura Z.

description: meh, for the price, there is definitely better quality japanese food elsewhere.
author: Long C.

description:
We had a table for 10 people, portion was small for a deluxe sashimi platter, but the fish sure were FRESH and delicious!!!! Display was pretty as well.

One of the staff/sever treated us with numerous hot sake (free) just because we had a birthday dinner there..... awesome!!!!!!
author: Dawn C.

description:
Sat at the sushi bar where we got to enjoy the hustle and bustle of the sushi chefs. Getting our initial order was a bit slow but our waitress was friendly and very helpful.

We ordered the highly recommended Hot Mama roll, a spicy hamachi roll, a spicy tuna roll, maguro nigiri, and tempura sweet potato rolls.

I did partake in the free sake 'check-in' which was nearly a disaster. After asking a few times for the drink, the waitress finally came over with a full flask of sake. Since she felt terrible, she said the sake was on her which was way more than the original offer was for. That was a very awesome gesture. 

Finished with the Mochi Sundae which was very delicious. Definitely recommend it.
author: Steve R.

description:
I love Kama Sushi, nice size rolls. Their sake selections are great. The ambiance of the place is very romantic. They have 2 big flat screen TV.

Real good place with tasty rolls! I don't mind coming here again!
author: Jackie A.

description:
Great place as always. I've been here many times and I must say it's a great experience each time.
There is a television near the bar for keeping up with games and such.
Great atmosphere for a small place.
author: Erran A.

description: FANTASTIC veggie ramen! Wish it was open more than only 4.5 hours a day. Local spot.
author: S B.

description: Ramen is really good not over cook the noodles are still crunchy up to the last bite sashimi are fresh and good chunky slices tempura are not oily decent size not too much flour, spicy hamachi and crab roll are also both good. Excellent presentation on every dish that i had. All in all for me food and service are superb
author: Allan A.

description:
Small sushi restaurant with a nice, romantic ambience and a widely varied menu. They had a lot of different kinds of sushi as well as some non sushi entree options. All for pretty reasonable prices as sushi tends to be expensive.

I wasn't very hungry when I came in, but was really excited to see they had a vegetarian section on the menu. I got a spring salad, which was slightly bigger than what you'd expect of a side/appetizer sized salad and had a yummy ginger miso dressing on it.  I also got the veggie dragon roll, which was filled with tempura sweet potato and topped by avocado and grilled eggplant. Also quite tasty. Overall, I was impressed, but not completely wowed.
author: Meryl S.

description:
Kama is my new sushi spot!  The menu is nice and varied.  The edamame was complimentary (always nice), and the miso was really good (not water down like lots of places).  When you check in on Yelp you get a free small saki!  And I got the Yelp $20 for $10 deal!

I hadn't even put one bite in my mouth and I already liked this place!  We started with the salmon tower which was amazing.  The sauces complimented each other perfectly--sweet and spicy--and the honey glazed fish was so so good with just a little crispiness from the sear.   

My bf ordered the sushi deluxe dinner and a spicy tuna hand roll and I ordered the Foxy roll.  All the fish was super fresh and they use REAL crab.  The Foxy roll was awesome--highly recommend it!  The only thing--and not a big deal--was that my bf ordered the red dragon roll, which came with his dinner combo, but they brought the rainbow roll instead.  Not a big deal--it wasn't disappointing.  

The service was prompt and friendly (my water glass was NEVER empty).  I loved the decor also--the beach wood branches were really cool--and it's nice and cozy, not cramped.

I will definitely recommend this place and will definitely be back!
author: Olivia D.

description: I wanted to like this place as I love sushi and I live close by to this restaurant BUT I was totally disappointed each time I went there or got take out. Simple things like asking them to add chicken to the ramine soup, but they wouldn't do it even when I offered to pay extra. When I was sitting at their bar on another visit I saw one of the sushi chiefs was touching the counters and other areas outside of the sushi bar area and then went to go make more sushi. But the topper was when I was there and a woman came in to pick up her order, apparently she ordered food from the other Kama Sushi location by mistake, and the host told her "too bad you better get it right next time", and did nothing to help her with the situation. The woman, who looked like she had a long day at work, looked so defeated, and just walked away empty handed.
author: Tristan H.

description:
Good ramen and happy hour specials.

Pleasant service.
author: Inigo M.

description: I'm a frequent diner at Kama Sushi and surprised that it only has 3.5 stars.  Now i'm very snooty about my Japanese restaurants and by no means is this place spectacular.. but the food is consistent and fresh and has one of the best hamachi kamas I've ever had.   It's very cozy and the staff is always warm and friendly.  We will always be repeat customers!
author: Jane K.

description:
I sat down and our waitress brought out a bowl of edamame.  I popped one into my mouth and noticed that there were no beans inside.  I put it back and tried another.  Same thing, no beans.  When I looked at the bowl, every edamame was empty and had already been eaten. I was given someone's pre-chewed edamame to eat.  I told the waitress and asked her, "Have I just eaten someone else's food?".  She said she didn't know and went into the kitchen with the bowl to ask.  After 5 minutes passed, she came out with a new appetizer and was very apologetic about the mistake and offered me a discount.

I decided to leave.  Personally, the only response I considered appropriate was a profuse apology and the offer of a free meal should I decide to stay.
author: Nick F.

description: Check-IN and get FREEE sake!!!! Its pretty good, not the best.
author: Lei F.

description: Kama is my favorite japanese restaurant in SF...Not only cause it's in my hood, but it's very delicious. I come here with my bf and bff and my ninjas (ORCA NINJA SQUA!T!!) often. We especially love the Hamachi Kama (highly-recommended!) --the lamb chops and their sashimi are amazing. Their ramen is on-point (which is conveniently offered as most Japanese restaurants don't in the city), and try their chef's specials. The servers treat us well, and are very attentive. The ambiance is intimate and the interior decor is beautiful (+cute!)...also we love the Japanese music playing in the background! Superb service, food options are wonderful, and in generous proportions...not to mention, the presentation looks brilliant as well. I bring all my guests here when they visit San Francisco, and they have all given the 5-star approval. Thank You Kama ^__^*
author: Zarah R.

description: Loved the vegetarian sushi options, especially because they used eggplant. Prices were decent, location isn't bad. Place is a little cramped but totally worth it. We were sitting near the window, which was nice but because we were in a corner, we were forgotten about for quite a bit. We got our food pretty quickly and it was delicious so good enough!
author: Pallavi K.

description:
So this place blew my mind for ramen.  Now, I'm not a ramen guru, but I've had a few bowls in my time in San Francisco, and I absolutely love the ramen that Kama serves -- great flavor, the pickled egg is phenomenal (don't knock it til you've tried it!).  It's the best I've had in the city so far, beating my experience in Japantown.  Doesn't hurt that it's damn close to where I live.  

When you go here for dinner, they serve you complimentary edamame, which is a really nice touch.  The service is decent - sometimes it can be hard to get the attention of the waitstaff, but generally they're attentive.  

The sushi is delicious as well.  Not the best I've had, but very good and reasonably priced.  This is probably a "duh" moment, but the sushi is better eaten in than taken out.  When we've taken out both ramen and sushi, the sushi got a bit warm (due to the soup).  It was still good, just not as good as it usually is.

Anyway, well worth the trip -- either for take out or eat in.  One of my go-to spots.
author: David D.

description: Satisfies a sushi craving when we don't want to wait in line or pay the price for Saru. It's close and fast and not crazy expensive. Not outstanding but always fresh. We've never eaten inside, just gotten take out.
author: Rachel R.

description:
A Yelp find from my BFF as we were in the area looking for Japanese food with a HH.  Started off great with finding parking easily around the corner.  BFF found a Yelp check in for FREE small sake and our waiter saw it on our phones and immediately brought us three.  The HH hour menu had great deals, so had to take advantage (as our waiter put it) and we were able to try quite a bit for $20 each including a large Sapporo for each of us!

The nice thing was FREE edamame (i hate when places charge, that's like charging for peanuts at a bar).  

Poke salad was excellent and no complaints with everything else...Soft Shell crab, veggie Tempura, Maguro, etc.. and the three of us were full!  Oh, we did have to go off the HH menu to order salmon belly, which was yummy!  That was almost $10 alone, but other than that, everything else was $3.50, $4 or $5.  Large beer - $4.
Definately, want to come back to Kama for Happy Hour!  Eating Japanese is not cheap, so love Happy Hour Specials.  Time is 5-630P, so get there at 5 when it opens!
author: Daphnie A.

description:
I tried Kama with my friend today. It was just in the okay range for me, it doesn't really have anything special to make me want to come back.

I like the Edamame that provide in the beginning. We ordered the Wakame Seaweed salad which there's not much to say because it taste like the seaweed would anywhere else, but it was good.
Then we order 3 rolls which were the Autumn, Foxy, and Hot MaMa and they were good but nothing crazy special. However I did like the autumn roll a lot because it was kind of like a tempuraed sushi, and I guess the mix with albacore was kind of nice. Everything else was so so... not bad but wasn't amazing. We also ordered a Tamago Nigiri which was yummy, the tamago was just right soft and not too sweet. 

We checked in and got a free small hot sake so that was a plus+.  However the food actually came out really slow, which was something I'm not that used to. and the portion was actually really small, so that was bad. I mean obviously I know that the portion is not suppose to be big but it really was smaller than the usual normal portion that I get at any other sushi place, and I eat at a lot of sushi restaurants. Each piece of sushi was just smaller than usual so you may want to order an extra roll or something else more filling.

The service was great! They were really friendly and awesome and checks up on you very constantly to make sure that everything was going good for you. They also play music and surprisingly they have Korean songs playing in between from time to time so being the kpop fan I am that made it kind of nice hahaha

All in all it's not bad, but not really my choice of place if I'm going for the food. It's kind of like a one time thing and I'm done, but definitely go and try for yourself since this is a personal opinion.
author: Lisa S.

description: Sushi here is consistent and good. Preparation and freshness are good. Not amazing, but good. Service here is different, you will pretty much have to call someone over when you want something so just be aware. Free tee and free edemame are quite nice. The interior decorating is well done.
author: Will D.

description:
After getting a tip that this place served some tasty ramen, I decided that I needed to give it a shot. I was not disappointed. 

The shop itself is small but inviting. You could probably call it "intimate" if you wanted to. The decor is modern but cozy.
 
We showed up about 6:35 on a Thursday, and despite having missed happy hour by 5 mins, they still provided us with a happy hour menu and gave us the happy hour prices (+10). 

Our food was served up quickly, and was really quite good. I ordered the spicy tonkotsu ramen which had a hearty serving of chashu pork that melted in my mouth as I ate it, a rich, delicious ramen broth, and nice, chewy noodles. The hard boiled egg, which I'm usually happy to give away, had been simmered in a dashi-based sauce and was filled with umami goodness. 

Will definitely seek out Kama again when I get another ramen itch.
author: Rachel T.

description:
The fish here - it was nice and generally fresh. The cuts were a little thick (yes that can happen - makes things a bit too chewy) or perhaps the angles was off. The rolls (albeit not my thing) are curious.  There's a whole column of rolls that are deep fried.  Thing about it is, when you tempura fry a roll two things happen: 1) delicious greasy crunchy yummy and 2) any and all unique or subtle flavor stays in the oil.  So why a whole gaggle of rolls with this preparation?  I dunno.  What's a collection of sushi rolls called anyhow?  Lets go with 'mat' instead of 'gaggle'.  A mat of sushi rolls here appears to be deep fried.  

You'll recognize this place by its Virgin America style mood lighting with two big flat screen TVs.  Kama, it's new.  People kinda shuffle around.  Get a little confused.  I get that.  The servers were very friendly.  I sat at the bar and the sushi chef kept asking me about the food rather cautiously. 

I'm going to go back and try eating more straight up sashimi & nigiri...see if the cuts got better.  Just skip the mat.
author: David S.

description: Sashimi was provided in generous slices and tasted fresh and delicious. The rolls... Pyramid roll tasted a little weird. I don't think the rice they use is very good. The rest is great.
author: Gleb P.

description:
Staff is friendly and good service. It's a super small place, the service better be good.
My rule prior to rating any spot to give it a shot at least twice unless the place was so outrageously horrible. I would go back for their happy hour because the special prices, but there are way too many other great options close by. Kama Sushi does give you a Yelp deal--free sake if you check in via Yelp--a good thing.
author: Al G.

description:
The food here was fine, we mainly got Sushi, and while better than a sushi boat place, I've had better. It was good for being close and in the neighborhood, which I liked.

However, the service was horrible. Our waiter began to walk away while taking our order so that we could barely get our drink orders out. He brought us the wrong orders or forgot them altogether on multiple occasions. He also disappeared completely on us and we had to wait forever on the check. My family says they'll be back but I'm not so sure.
author: M F.

description: Happy hour is cool and the family loves it! A favorite neighborhood spot for us! Tataki albacore was yummy, basic rolls on point, maguro loved, hamachi kama delish, sake & beer to wash it down & spicy is spicy!
author: Salina M.

description: The food was just ok. Delivery was prompt and polite and the website easy to navigate. What I really didnt like was paying $70 for a lunch bag size of food. Rolls were small. Sashimi was decent. Probably wouldnt try again.
author: Disco B.

description: It's a good local spot. The baked roll hot mama was the best (though not quite as good as Sushi Zone's). The spicy tuna didn't taste fresh; minus one star for that. Salmon and toro were solid. They gave free edamame and the tea was good and flowing. I'd go back, but wouldn't run there.
author: Andrew K.

description: Love Kama for sushi, ramen and  udon! Can't go wrong with an order from Kama
author: Kathleen O.

description: We're a fan of this place.  Josh and Gerry almost always get the Chirashi Don, which is the chef's choice of fresh fish atop sushi rice.  Plus, other random rolls that are consistently good.  Topped off with some hot sake, you can't go wrong!
author: Lily B.

description:
I went back in last night after-work, and caught happy hour Sushi. 
The usual Tuna Poke salad to start, a few Sapporos, and nigiri: walu, hamachi, etc.. 

Sad to see yellowtail wasn't on the happy-hour menu.

But nevertheless, I am very pleased. 
They even took out the flat screens and installed 2 heaters.

I can't wait to go back.
author: Ty T.

description: Food is pretty good especially their ramen soup... but service is so very POOR. I live in the neighborhood and have been to Kama three times... I came back three times hoping to see their customer service improve. I was disappointed! The skinny Asian guy that hosts regularly was consistently rude and dismissive. One day, we asked to be seated in a corner where it was kind of quiet but were flat out denied. No reason given, just a "No, we can't seat you there. You sit at the table we choose for you" attitude. Okay! Another day, they didn't give us the soup that came with the meal and we had to repeatedly ask for it. The guy that brought us the soup seemed agitated that we had the nerve to ask for something that should have been served us before our bento box arrived. Okay! A separate time, we asked for glasses of water with no ice and the skinny Asian guy brought us water with lots of ice! I believe that guy does not like working there, he should quit or be fired! Kama is in desperate need to improve customer service quickly or they will continue to lose their customers and eventually be forced to shut their doors. We will never dine at Kama again. Eric's, across the street, is the best alternative anyway, where the staff is wonderful and they show how appreciative they are of our business.
author: Susan Z.

description:
Great happy hour.

The regular menu has lots of options and you get complimentary edamame. 

Freshness is key and even before our order arrived at the table I could tell from the satisfied customers that it was not only going to be fresh but also delish. That assumption, unlike many others, was right on.
author: M R.

description: The sushi here is good. When I got the ramen it was horrible, so hopefully they work on that. The service is so-so. I've eaten here a few times, and the prices are decent.
author: M M.

description:
We had dinner here last night, and it was a really, really nice experience. I'll definitely go back. 

The food was good--but that's only part of why I'm giving it a good review. What I loved were the authentically Japanese touches--the shredded daikon radish in the tempura dipping sauce, which aids in digestion of fried food; the variety of pickled veg in the bento box, the fact that the menu had many different kinds of entrees and appetizers, including ramen, udon, and donburi. We saw a seafood salad at the next table that was huge and gorgeous. The prices are very reasonable as well. 

The waitstaff was thoughtful and attentive, and our waiter Roku was really sweet and interesting to talk with--really friendly. He even comped us our sake, which is an excellent customer service move, in my book.

Nice decor, good music. 

We used the Yelp deal, which was a total bargain. 

The fish was fresh and tasty. My grilled whole squid was a tiny bit overcooked, but the sauce had really good flavor and I nommed the whole thing anyway. 

Definitely destined to become a neighborhood standby for me.
author: Jamey M.

description:
Maybe I just had too high expectations, but I just wasn't impressed by Kama Sushi.  The restaurant was super cute and small and the service was excellent and attentive, but the food was only ok.

We got a bowl of the tonkatsu ramen and the karaage ramen and they were both ok.  It definitely wasn't anything memorable, but it was fine.
author: Lisa C.

description:
Kama Sushi has a solid happy hour! 

Happy Hour is EVERYDAY (yes, S M T W R F S) from 5PM - 6:30PM

You get a free hot sake if you check-in on Yelp, too! 

My friend from LA and I visiting for the first time this past weekend. We told our waiter it was a our first time checking out the restaurant and he gave us some hot sake on the house! 

You get a pretty good deal for nigiri: $2.95 for two pieces. I tried the sake (salmon) and I was pleased. Got a few other roles off the HH menu (each $4.95). Be sure to try the spicy salmon! 

Friendly staff, clean facilities, and quality sushi! 

You should definitely check out this sushi spot if your looking for a great sushi in Noe Valley. It is definitely a quaint little hole-in-in the wall.
author: Drea B.

description:
My uncle judges a restaurant's service level by how long his water glass is left empty for. I tell you what, Kama Sushi gets an A+ by his standards. The service is great - kind and prompt.

The food was excellent too. Very fresh fish. My only complaint is that it is a bit expensive. For example, the Sunomono (cucumber salad) was $5 for a tiny little mound of cucumbers....I mean, come on. A whole cucumber costs $1, and the amount they serve in this dish is like 1/4 of a cucumber, so the mark up is like 20X. 

All in all, very good though.
author: Serena Q.

description: Been here a few times good place for the happy hour.  Would not visit if not on happy hour.  Tuna poki is my favorite.
author: Roman R.

description:
I am a big sashimi fan and the sashimi here is awesome. Always fresh and great quality. 

The few times I've had the rolls they were good as well.

Wifey ordered a Chicken Donburi last time, which left a little to be desired...

The place is very small and it's Noe Valley, so you might get some kids running around in there, but overall the place is solid.
author: Phil M.

description:
The Dynamite balls were in fact deliciously dynamite, and the lemon slices on the 49er roll were appropriately paper thin.

Delicious food and mostly good service - a little slow but they were nice about it.  

A 4 instead of a 5 because it just isn't quite as good as Ichi, but I'll come back to Kama - good sushi for a reasonable price.
author: Caryl S.

description:
We ordered delivery from Kama through Grub Hub and the fish was definitely not fresh.  I have a pretty iron stomach and am relatively cavalier about getting sushi in dodgy places like airports and super markets.  But, Kama's sashimi made me sick.  Fortunately, I felt like something was a bit off and told my wife to stay away from it.  

To add insult to injury, we ordered on a Tuesday night so they really should have been serving fresh fish.
author: Max V.

description:
