We walked in to this intimate space on a Tuesday night after work and instantly fell in love with the space. Dimly lit, earth tones and dark wood, tree branches affixed to the walls as art.  We were seated at a table in a half-full room and within 30 minutes the remaining tables had been filled. 

Complimentary edamame was a nice touch and the house nigori sake is inexpensive and delicious. Great selection and prices on the sushi were validated once the food arrived. Three rolls and the 7 piece sashimi special was perfect for two. Conversation was easy even in the small capacity room. The ambiance was ideal and service was efficient. Definitely will return and recommend.
author: Jason R.

description:
This place was great. My girl and I love sushi and we were looking for a place close to her apartment in Noe Valley. We typically travel to different neighborhoods for sushi, but wanted to stay local and found this place on Yelp so we tried it. The people there were so nice. Since she lived in the neighborhood, the owner bought us our first round of sake.

Everyone was so friendly, the place was clean with a nice decor, and the sushi was good. It came out very fast and we really enjoyed it. They also played really good music.

We will definitely go back. I definitely recommend this place.
author: Adam W.

description:
There is nothing better than a sushi restaurant - hell, any restaurant - that truly cares about their customers. Kama treats every single person who walks in the door like a local. Aside from the friendly attitude, the food is spectacular. Top it off? Completely reasonable rates. Oh, and did I mention that they have a fantastic happy hour?! Yeah, exactly.

See you there.
author: Tiffany B.

description:
Great little neighborhood sushi place! Has a TV (muted) so you can sit at the sushi bar and watch the news or sports or whatever it is you want to watch.

The staff is extremely friendly and gave us some wonderful recommendations on what to order. Try the lobster roll - its incredible. The fried green tea ice cream is also great for dessert.
author: Katie S.

description:
Not a destination restaurant, but they did a good job across the board.  They have an extensive menu of much more than basic (or fancy) rolls, including a wide variety of fried appetizers / small plates and less Westernized specialties, which I really appreciate.  It's a small place, and we sat at the counter -- service was great.  Much better than expected at this kind of Japanese place.  

They handled the Yelp coupon professionally, without any confusion -- an unfortunate rarity with online coupons.  

The lack of a fifth star is only because it's not much better than any of a number of other small Japanese restaurants in the city, and thus not worth much of a trip -- I'll be back.  (It's also moderately pricey at dinner; they have lunch specials).
author: Zachary R.

description:
Good, solid neighborhood sushi spot.

I stop by Kama once a month or so for lunch on the weekends and get their special bento box with spicy tuna and hamachi negi rolls. The soup, salad and fun little side veggies are tasty, and the rolls are always great. The free edamame, however, is oddly awful. It's cold, which I can deal with, but it's also super stringy and almost difficult to eat. Can't complain too much though, since during lunchtime it is free.

Would love tot try out the more exciting rolls, bur for now I'm sticking to the affordable, $10 lunch special. If you're nearby in Noe, feel free to stop by and try out what Kama has to offer!
author: Nicole H.

description: Kama has a great happy hour, a GREAT yelp check-in deal, great food, and very good service.  We live in Ingleside, and drive here for Sushi because it is significantly better than anything nearby!  Kama is a hidden gem.
author: Ashley H.

description: 3.5 stars, but I'll add 0.5 star for the convenience. Good, fresh fish and walking distance from my house.  Service lacks in efficiency, but take-out is pretty seamless.
author: Janelle F.

description:
I've been coming to this place since they opened. I have two other reviews up from 2011 and 2012 as well. They have gone a little downhill over the years but it's still good quality good. The customer service isn't as great as it used to be, but nothing major. My only real complaint would be the pricing, cos I consider this place to be somewhat expensive. I actually don't really eat here very often anymore because I can't afford it. Somethings are properly priced but others are a few dollars too much. But they do have some yummy things that are worth it though! My FAVORITE things is their fire cracker balls. They are unlike any other deep fried roll I've ever had and they are always perfect! I haven't personally had it but I've heard their Ramen is pretty good. I enjoyed their tempura Udon. Their fish is always fresh and good which is important and the main reason why I still consider them one of the better sushi places. Their portions are usually pretty good and not skimpy but also not huge. 
It's a pretty small and intimate restaurant and definitely would be good for a date or something like that. Overall its a good place and hasn't been very disappointing despite a few set backs.
author: Tara S.

description:
(I must say I haven't had a sit down lunch or dinner here, only to go, so the review will be about that.) We live a couple of blocks from this place and on a Sunday evening I was really craving an Udon soup, so Yelp guided us here after two unsuccessful attempts at other Japanese restaurants that either didn't have a to go Udon or were closed on Sunday.

The staff at Kama Sushi is very friendly, they took our order and since we wanted to wait, they had us sit at the bar and served us tea. We ordered a Tori (Chicken) and Niku (beef) Udon, they had them ready in about 15 minutes, which made me think they were made fresh ;-) Aaaaand when we got home and ate our soups, we knew this was a good choice.
author: Timea B.

description:
While I normally don't give 1 star reviews, I think this deserves it. I ate here and got sick. The health department is the first call I make in the morning tomorrow.

I eat sushi all the time, I know whats good, whats not and what I can deal with so this is not some kind of noob problem.

The fish was old, it didn't taste right, I knew that from the first bite. I thought it was just one piece, no, it was all of it. I paid the price for eating it, and this review is the price they paid for serving it. This place needs to fire their fish buyer, I suspect I could get better fish from a chain grocery store.

The hygiene practiced there was poor.
I know, I watched; The chef had his freaking iphone out on the counter, was texting constantly and didn't wash his hands.
Gross.

Also, their menu was an engrish bomb. The only redeeming feature was that their staff was nice, however lacked any real knowledge of what sushi was actually about. The guy with the rat-tail was a nice touch...
author: Tom S.

description:
I'd give this place a C-- 

I usually order food to go, so I can't comment on table service.  We usually get the chirashi don which was pretty good a few months ago, but now it has gone down hill.  It used to be consistent with great cuts of fish and salmon roe.  I mentioned at one time that the chef forgot to give us tuna, but I was corrected by the person taking the order that it was "chef's choice".  Well, I've never had chirashi don without tuna- and I sort of took his suggestion as to diffuse the situation.

So, I ordered again, because I used to love their food and their staff is really nice.  But, to my chagrin, this time there was not much fish.  The "chef" was feeling stingy and I guess didn't want my business anymore.  For 50 dollars, (for 2 chirashi don) I don't think that this was good value.  

I don't suggest ordering chirashi don here if you like that sort of thing.
author: John L.

description: Terrible service --- open sign was lit, and I was denied service.......enough said!
author: Dain D.

description: Tried this place for the first time tonight.  We ordered out.  It was super!  The fish was fresh, the menu was great...we had hamachi toro, uni and ankimo among other things.  They were great, the White Out roll was superb, too!  Definitely planning to come back!
author: Lori M.

description:
Replacing the delicious, but epically NOT ambient Amberjack Sushi, Kama steps into the big shoes nicely. The atmosphere is a major improvement. The food is good, but not as original as Amberjack's rolls.

It's only its first day, but here are three things I hope they keep up
1. friendly attentiveness. 
2. bringing out edamame to start and green tea ice cream to finish. 
3. big portions, especially on seaweed salad. yum and yeah.
author: Shannon W.

description: I met a friend/co-worker visiting friends in the city  for the week.  My sister recommended we go to Kama Sushi to have lunch.  LOVE IT!  Roku, the waiter is super nice and super on it.  He took take of my friend and I.  I will definitely be back to dine here again and highly recommend sushi lovers to go check it out.  I'm very picky and this place was fresh and so good.
author: Liz D.

description: This place it's awesome. I love small restaurants versus franchises. Anyways food food decent price not to expensive and check in gets a hot sake which is sweet. Love it!
author: Tania S.

description:
I was sitting on this review for a few weeks mulling over what to say.  I've been to Kama Sushi enough times now to form an informed opinion.  I suppose the last visit there made me not want to return.  To sum up why I won't be back:  1) food is just OK but expensive, 2) menu is limited not many dinner choices and 3) the head waiter has a bad attitude, forgot to bring us our food -- and, get this,  gave us our bill before serving our food.  How f-ed up is that?

Anyway, I had high expectations for this place after Amberjack left and Kama took over.  I gave the place enough chances, but am giving up on this one.  There's just too many other good restaurant choices in the city with much better prices, but I am still searching for a reasonably priced, good Japanese place.
author: barry a.

description:
Came here a few nights ago. Didn't realize it was a new kid on the block.

Got there at 8:30, which was bad on our part because they ran out of Monkfish liver and quail eggs =( 

Got the chef's choice sashimi, which was pretty good for the most part, though a little heavy on the tuna selections (4 pieces regular, 2 tataki style) - would have liked more variety. Will probably order separately next time.

YUMS:
: The whitefish and yellowtail were great
: UNI - very nice that day, great color and texture, bold uni flavor. Two for $6 is a friggin' great deal  

UMS
: Miso soup - the usual mix
: Salmon was eh, and cut kinda funny with ridges, weird, no?

DUMS
: (Recommend by waitress since they ran out of monkfish) Grilled  whole squid - seems like it was flash grilled, or not defrosted well, because it was mushy on the inside though charred on the outside (and came out luke warm.)
: Ikura - not fresh, sticky and ultra salty
: Ame ebi - also not fresh, very disappointing, a little slimy, weird taste, and the fried heads' batter had a weird tasting flavor

The sushi chef was pretty rude to one of the waitresses and yelled at her, making the room a little awkward for a sec. The servers were very nice.

Would go again because it's so close to me, but I'll stay away from any  of the grilled dishes. Interested in their udon, which is pricey at $14, so hoping it'll be great. But definitely NOT a destination location.
author: Jessica W.

description: You get free sake when you check in on Yelp. Sushi during happy hour is a good deal and the ramen is pretty tasty.
author: Xteethx B.

description:
We asked for more side dish and they just gave us
More and hid the cost in the final bill. The seevice was great. But the food was not worthy and just ok...
author: Josh K.

description: Great especially during happy hour. Defiantly a go to spot for a early dinner.
author: Jeremy B.

description: When I was younger, my family used to come to the Japanese restaurant that was here before Kama on a weekly basis, so we were a little sad when they were no longer there. Fortunately, we fell in love with Kama and the people that work there! The wait staff are super friendly and the food is absolutely sinful! The Pyramid roll has to be my favorite sushi item. Also the Ramen is really good (and I'm realllly picky about my ramen). Definitely a great spot for a date, or to shove delicious food in your face with your family like I do.
author: Monica M.

description: first time and last, the hostess show me my table, I got my ademamme and water very fast, after that I waited 20min. and nothing no waiter! I asked  someone for a beer and nothing!  I left the restaurant, at the door hostess told me,,Im sorry we have a lot of delivery orders,,  that's it !!....  whaaaat?   oook what about me???   ..   I went to  the other sushi place two blocks away,,  what a difference
author: Henry G.

description: Food was just ok. Would not recommend for the quality of food and service. Plus parking is pretty bad for this part of the city. tables were dirty and unprepared when we stepped in, waited way too long for food. Meh.
author: Sophie L.

description: Really fresh sushi and great sticky rice. I've tried a few of the appetizers and a couple rolls and will continue to come back for more. They are usually busy as soon as they open but there is always a table open. The place is small so expect to share a conversation with your neighbors! But they also do take out and will call you when your order is ready.
author: Kelly F.

description:
Hands down best sushi in SF.

Ive been going there every weekend for the past month or so, and every time its better. Sake menu is great (kinda pricey for the good stuff tho), Fish is fresher than anything Ive ever had (Walu FTW), service is perfect (there when you need them, not when you dont), and the atmosphere is nice and intimate, without being super crammed and loud (at least until the hip Noe families decide to meet up for dinner with their poor kids at 8pm. Seriously, get a sitter and order them a pizza, its better for everyone!)

Oh, and they have great noodles too. 

Just come here. Well worth the trip.
author: Gerhart H.

description:
First visit was great. Thought I'd found a new go-to sushi place. The C27 roll was amazing.
Second visit was less wonderful. Took forever to get my order and quality seemed lower.
Third time confirmed that quality is consistently average rather than great. Service is lackluster - there were only three parties in the whole restaurant and I did not get a single look from the staff between getting my food and getting my check. No water refill, no nothing.
author: Brian W.

description: Now that the sting of Amberjack leaving has dissipated, I can say I love my new neighborhood sushi place. Such wonderful employees, and I love their veggie options (since I'm vegan). Most recently got their Veggie Dragon Roll... holy shite was it so tasty! The Veggie Futomaki is deliciously spicy.
author: Giovanna C.

description:
Butterfish?  Yes please.  

I finally made it out last night to check out the new sushi place on the corner that replaced that old sushi place that used to be on the corner (which i really liked).  I was prepared for this to be another "standard fare" sushi place with all the typical menu items.  That's not a bad thing - I am an equal opportunity sushi lover, especially when it's convenient.  But it was way better than that.  

The ambiance is way nicer now - a much more inviting option for a spontaneous dinner out in the neighborhood.  The menu looks fairly standard at first glance, but it's a bit more focused with more distinctive options in each section.  They have a few items on their nigiri menu that you don't often see outside of a specials list.  The roll selection is varied with a lot of interesting (mostly cooked) combinations.

We ordered a range of options from the menu.  It was all delicious, but the big winner was the nigiri.  We went for the slightly less common options, foregoing salmon and tuna for the more exotic butterfish, scallop, and monkfish liver.  Deeeeeelicious!  This is not your standard neighborhood  sushi.  

Now that I know the fish is so fresh, next time I'll focus on the simpler, more fish-focused sushi options rather than the fancy combinations.  In fact, I might go back tonight and order just butterfish and scallop nigiri to go.  And tomorrow, and the next day.
author: Amy H.

description: Very good ramen and special rolls just needs work on service.
author: Kay D.

description:
I've been ordering take out online from this place for well over a year. I'll admit it, I like the bento box with chicken and veggie tempura. It's quick, consistent, tasteful and filling. They've recently changed their menu to only 1 item (chicken) with miso, rice and salad. When I called to inquire about the change, customer service was not awesome. In fact, very disappointing as the woman could clearly see my order history, knowing I have been a consistent customer for a while now. Bummer to have to find a new go to in the neighborhood. 
PS. I love sushi, and have ordered their sushi once online. only once.
author: Lyz S.

description: I don't normally hang out in Noe Valley, but a group of friends was having dinner at Kama so I joined.  I was very impressed by the freshness of the fish, and the service was great.  Only down side was that they didn't have Uni.  They were out of it that day, and it sounded like they usually carry it.
author: Alicia G.

description:
A small joint with decent sushi with pretty good service, but not much stands out.  The nigiri here was the tastiest, specifically the Sake.  

The place is pretty small but the decor is tasteful and the whole mood pretty intimate.  Nice place for a casual 1st-3rd date that won't destroy your wallet, but there are better places.  I'd go there again, but I wouldn't say it'd be my go to.
author: Vincent-Arthur B.

description:
All I got was a simple Oyako don. The chicked was disgusting. It was slimey and terrible. The egg was not cooked enough and runny.

My girlfriend got a 49er Roll, which she said wasn't too bad. So I'll give it 2 stars since her's wasn't so bad. But my experience was awful.
author: Tim E.

description:
I saw a Yelp offer for this restaurant, and on a whim I bought the offer and went out there that same evening for dinner before attending a Cirque du Soleil Totem performance.

Like many others in the area, this is a nice, small, and cozy neighborhood restaurant.  The service was nice.

As for the food, I thought the sushi was fresh and delicious.  I ordered a deluxe dinner combo that came with five pieces of nigiri, four pieces of sashimi, and a dragon roll.  I tacked it on by ordering a half dozen raw oyster in addition, as well as a large hot sake, which is discounted for happy hour (along with some other drink selections) if you start your dining in before 6:30pm.

I checked in on the Yelp mobile application and found they had a check-in offer of a free small hot sake.  It was too bad that I already ordered the large one and decided to be safe and not get that small one also for fear of drinking too much.  I will likely come again though before going to a performance or other event on a weeknight since this restaurant is not too far from my workplace.
author: H K.

description:
Great vegetarian selection of rolls!

Excited about eating here more in the future.
author: Jeff M.

description:
LOVE hole the wall sushi spots! Pretty sure this is what San Francisco is all about.

I came here with a big group of friends and not only were the accomodating to our group size, but the service was right on! Our glasses were never half empty (of full depending on your life philosophy) and I'm pretty sure I always had food in front of me!

The ahi and tempura shrimp dishes are to DIE for! 

I will def. come here again...and maybe this time not drink so much damn sake...Ah who am I kidding? Yay Kama!
author: Stacy L.

description:
Food was nicely done, but the cook has issues with taste when it comes to their sauces and miso soup. Very bland flavors. Tempura sauce tasted watery. Teriyaki sauce was lacking in flavor. Very unfortunate because they obviously know how to make the dishes just not how they are to be sauced or accompanied with sauce. 
I may try it again to see if it was a fluke, but I'm sure they just don't get it. I brought it to the attention of the waitress and she brought an extra sauce which was the same as the first. Then she made the mistake of telling me how that is what Tempura sauce tastes like. Only thing is, I lived in Japan for a few years and worked in many Japanese restaurants.
author: meg g.

description: Kama is pretty decent, I would go again, they forgot my friend's miso soup but what evs :)
author: Joonier Y.

description:
Decent delicious happy hour servings plus the yelp check in offer make this place 4 star worthy. 

Hopefully the one opening at SOMA wont be disappointing (pricewise).
author: Lady K.

description: We came in looking for some good sushi and were pleasantly surprised. The sushi came out very quickly and the rolls were great! We had a crunchy lobster roll (amazing) and a 49ers roll. We will definitely be back. We were in and out in no time!
author: Paige S.

description:
I've had more bad experiences than good ones here. First, the hostess here is terrible. She told me to wait for one table, then when it was cleared she changed her mind and asked me to wait for another table--but didn't seat anyone at this open table. Then stuck us at a table that was in the worst cramped location--that bench behind the sushi bar. There are too many tables in such a small area. Then about 10 minutes later as another party arrived I watched the hostess give them menus and water as our table was still empty.... I asked if she could bring us menus and water and chopsticks, this took another few minutes. 

This is not a good way to start a meal. Deal with your customers in the order they arrive. Set expectations and meet them. Do not treat your paying customers like they are burdoning you. And I'll be honest, I only come here because it's close. But I will go down the street to the other sushi restaurant which has better service. 

The food is mediocre and frankly I don't think the snow crab is real and the unagi never tastes clean or fresh. Our shrimp tempura wasn't even crispy. If you can't get the fundamentals right, then there's no hope. I rarely judge a restaurant by one meal, but three meals in a row have been completely crap here. I will never return.
author: Won't B.

description: Decent service, food ok. Not happy about the fact that when it says snow crab in the menu but actually comes out as artificial crab meat.
author: Shusheng L.

description:
Wow! This place is great! Best sushi so far in my neighborhood!
I ordered delivery several times and also been in the place itself - their Signature rolls called 'Hot Mama' is awesome!!! Definitely the best I've ever tried!
Also delivery is the same quality as in the place which is great also - fresh and quick.
author: Kate A.

description: How can you run a restaurant when you charge people food they never received? And as noticed by other people, our waiter didn't provide any explanation. At least he made a gesture to soften the bill. In terms of sushis, not much to write about. It is just ok.
author: Bernard N.

description: Great place! I don't have one bad thing to say. Edamame once you sit down. The wakame salad and miso soup were great starters. And wow the fire cracker ball roll...we should've ordered two. Even the spicy asparagus was delicious. I would come back again and again but I don't live here...but I'll be back when I visit.
author: Corinne S.

description: We're regulars.  The food quality here is consistently good, which is my main criteria.  We've brought guests here several times and recently took my parents here when they were visiting from out of town and they were very pleased with the food.  We've also gotten takeout from here many times.  We've had the sushi as well as the cooked food, such as chicken skewers, karaage, ramen (spicy miso, tonkatsu, and tempura), seafood udon soup, and it's all been delicious.
author: Cy C.

description: Don't try ordering. Late every time, this is totally unprofessional!
author: Nicolas E.

description: This place had a great selection of sashmi and nice rolls. It was cozy and the wait staff was attentive. Probably the best yellowtail belly and aji I have had. It was reasonably price for good sushi. If you are in the neighborhood it's worth stopping in for some delicious food. It's a winner!
author: Jill T.

description: I came here for dinner the other night and I had a good experience. The service was fantastic and I was pretty pumped to get in on a Saturday night with no reservation. The food was a bit of a let down. I ordered several pieces of nigiri and that was okay, I also did a 12 piece of the chef's special Sashimi and this is where the meal took a dive. I wasn't a fan of the sashimi so it's hard for me to give this place more than 3 stars. However, I did like the cozy environment, service and the complementary edamame. I really wanted to like this place so I will be back to reevaluate whether they had an off night.
author: Ken C.

description: Amazing happy hour!  You can eat and drink an entire meal ( not just apps ) for happy hour.   Great sushi too.
author: Jon G.

description: Staff is great and Roku has always been so attentive. I recommend anyone to come visit KAMA SUSHI....
author: Daniel V.

description:
The transition from our beloved Amberjack was somewhat difficult - but at the end, it's worth it. The fish is fresh and the portions generous. The presentation is stylish. The service can be slow (it never bothered me), but even if the restaurant looks empty, don't forget to count the numerous orders for deliveries!
Happy hours became a nice way to dine out - with fantastic prices for a decent choice - it gives more room to order that special pricey item you'd wanted to try. 
While free delivery is the quick safe option for a busy night.

Service to children is outstanding. (which means, yeah Kama is located in downtown Stroller Valley, and it shows).
author: Sophie S.

description: Just a little too slow and the dishes weren't as memorable. They're kind people though, I usually give spots the benefit of the doubt because of said kindness. I just won't go back.
author: RJ L.

description: I have to admit I didn't have high hopes when coming here. I thought it was going to be your over typical priced, lacking in flavor, Noe Valley sushi joint. However, I was pleasantly surprised. I got tempura udon and my boy friend got spicy ramen. They were perfect on a cold night. We also got two rolls. There fish was fresh and the rolls were flavorful. YUMMY! As an added bonus they have a great dessert menu. Not something I've seen in most Japanese restaurants. I will defiantly  be saving room for some sweeties next time I go. :)
author: Sarah k.

description:
This is my second review for Kama sushi. 
Very impressed by them AGAIN. 
My wife is pregnant and she was very happy and satisfied  their menu!

Thanks Kama! Keep it up!
author: Tony L.

description: I asked the chef to prepare some sushi that was the best/most fresh, and he made four types, each more delicious than the last. I was told by my Japanese friend that this is Tokyo style sushi, which often has some sauce in it, and I noticed the chef does add some flavors, and you are not supposed to put it in soy sauce. This is good advice, because the flavor is amazing. The staff is very friendly too. Highly recomended!
author: Shelly H.

description: Very tasty with awesomely delicious ramen! The service staff is extremely nice, although sometimes overwhelmed (they were so busy that it took forever to pay our bill).
author: Kimhouy T.

description: Wow... Big turnaround from the Amberjack of old.  Fresh, tender cuts of sashimi deftly seasoned and amply portioned.  A deliciously prepared, chef special Nancy roll consisting of spicy tuna, avocado, asparagus and topped with seared escolar and tobiko.  Gracious service, great food -- bring it!
author: Don N.

description: Ordered albacore sashimi, hamachi sashimi and a california roll. All fresh and delicious. Clean and comfortable along with great service. I have nothing bad to say about Kama!
author: Neek W.

description: I love that Kama is a perfect after work hot spot in Noe Valley. Kama has the best garlic edamame in the city (believe me I have tried them all) and order it with Tamari for a sweeter and gluten free bite. The chicken karaage is also better than any other spot in the area! I always have a wonderful dinner at Kama! The service is friendly and genuine. My partner and I eat at Kama once a week, we are foodies, and we love our neighborhood sushi hot spot! Its not the most expensive, but it is the best! Roku is the best host, so go get your sushi on now! Ask for Roku and get the garlic edemame!! xoxo
author: Courtney W.

description:
Great and fresh sushi.
I loved the spicy tuna and the udon.
Great sake too!
(And affordable prices and nice service!).

Highly recommended!
author: Pippo P.

description: We have been very pleased with the new addition of Kama Sushi to our neighborhood!  Love the wait staff and the food has always been fresh and tasty.  Tried the happy hour specials and the lunch offerings so far.  For lunch really enjoy the special bento box with a lot of food for a good price: tea, soup, rice, great salad, pickled veggies, and 2 items [so far have enjoyed chicken katsu, chicken teriyaki, mixed tempura, various maki rolls, and spicy tuna roll].
author: Shawn H.

description: Outstanding service, great tasting sushi with a modern twist and family (kids) friendly.
author: Vi P.

description: Bento box was really good. Table of four on a saturday night and surprisingly, we did not have to shout to hear each other across the table. The bill was expensive but the food was good. Tempura was nice and crunchy too. Will go back again
author: Rachel A.

description: Great neighborhood joint with a Yelp check-in deal to boot! Plus, they have AMAZING eggplant nigiri for vegetarians like me. I hate eggplant, and I have to restrain myself from getting several orders every time I visit!
author: Kristan S.

description: WTF? This place is so delicious I can hardly stand it! Try the Hot MaMa and the Hot PaPa roll. Best part is they deliver and everything is always so yummy, I have never ate in I always get delivery, and delivery is always quick and on time.
author: Zoe Z.

description: The ambience is warm and friendly.  The decor was beautifully done. am a fan of Hamachi Kama and the succulence of this dish made me very happy and with getting a few rolls and sushimi my party of 7 were extremely pleased. Although myself and my husband are from NY, the rest of our group are from SF and luckily for them they can return again and again whereas we have to wait till next year. Prices were fair and portions were normal.  Having the special offer of the free saki didn't hurt.
author: Judy H.

description: Me and my husband finally tried this place. This place has a long list of the menu. Spicy Edamame was very good. Sushi was also good. But Cucumber Sunomono tasted old.. Might go back for Edamame:)
author: Maitai N.

description: My boyfriend and I went here for Valentine's Day and had a great experience. The service was excellent, and the food was fresh and delicious. We both had miso soup  (perfect) and sashimi plates (fresh and generously sliced), and we shared the wakame salad, which was a good sized portion for an appetizer. The total came to about $35 for two people, and we both left very satisfied. This is a neighborhood gem, and we will definitely be back.
author: Lindsey N.

description: good sushi for a great price and also a lot of variation including mochi wrapped bacon skewers! 49ers rolls and salmon sashimi were great!
author: Jocy V.

description: Not only is this new my favorite SF sushi spot...I'm lucky enough to live the same neighborhood too! They certainly got everything right for this restaurant, from the mood, and ambiance - to the most important... the cuisine! Here, you can see where sushi and art come together, with fabulous roles that combine tastes and texture... the mango tango for example was a delight. The waiter even had us taste some new really creative desserts that were fabulous. I can't wait to go back and taste every single thing on the menu! Delish.
author: Lalaina R.

description: Great low-key neighborhood sushi joint. Good food, good prices, and free sake (with Yelp checkin). Grab a chirashi bowl for cheap!
author: Max E.

description:
I went to Kama Sushi by myself and I got the Chef's Choice Sashimi... I agree with Jessica that there's too much tuna. Not really worth it for the price that they charge. Everything is fresh and all good but there is just nothing that wows me. Their yahitori is tasty but then again.. nothing special.

I like that they gave a small bowl of edimame for the appetizer and a small scoop of ice cream for dessert. The green tea icecream was disappointing though, it's not the matcha green tea type, it's more of the syrupy sweet green tea that you can get at safeway or something...

I would've given the restaurant maybe 3/5 but there was a misunderstanding. My bill came to be about $27 or so I gave $35 expecting to receive some $1's back to give as tip. They gave me back the bill book with nothing inside except the copy of the receipt. I asked the waitress if I was getting my change back. I know I speak softly but she just gave me a puzzled look. Then she realized that I wanted change and she was surprised saying that she assumed I was going to give all the change as tips. So they went and fix it... instead of giving me back my actual change, they gave me less. It clearly said $6.90 in change and they gave me back $3, so took their tips out of my change for me without asking. I just left the restaurant, not wanting to tell them that they should learn how to do some basic arithmetic and give customers back their change. I hate it when waiters and waitress automatically assume that you want to give all of your change as tips. They should at the very least ask before not giving any change back.. I mean WTF. is this.

Better sushi places in the city, not coming here again.
author: Aaron H.

description: Yummy sushi. Reasonable prices and helpful staff!
author: Michelle L.

description: We used to be regulars at Amberjack and loved the food but I'd always say "if only they... changed the decor/got rid of the disinfectant smell/played some music... this place would do great". Well, Kama sushi has done all of that. Really nice ambience, great service, nice on-the-house edamame and green tea ice-cream (though that might just be for opening week). The food was all tasy, especially some melt-in-your-mouth hamachi, but nothing unusual on the menu. I'd say a great local restaurant, really happy to have it here, probably wouldn't travel all the way across town for it.
author: susannah b.

description: I liked Amberjack Sushi, but Kama is better. Fresh fish, better ambiance.  Green tea ice-cream, with strawberries, whipped cream, drizzled with chocolate. Yum.
author: doug d.

description:
Sushi was good, service was really attentive. Unfortunately they couldnt help being slow. While the sushi was good, they were small.

So I would recommend at least trying it, maybe your experience will be a better one.
author: Brent A.

description: this place is a good neighborhood spot! Inventive rolls, not too expensive, and they have some happy hour specials. they also have non-raw fish stuff for people who are not into the sushi...
author: Meredith M.

description: Great service, fresh sushi, delicious ramen -- what's not to like?  Glad this is in my neighborhood, and I'd go more often if I could!  Definitely worth the trip even if you're not in Noe Valley, though!
author: Carlo A.

description:
My husband and I have been customers now going on 2 or 3 years our experience is still top notch everyone great but Roku that is usually our server has been a huge part of our excellent dining experience excellent service courteous and we have recommended many friends which have been pleased with the service and great sushi recommendations he makes for guests...we recently renewed our wedding vows and after the ceremony we chose to continue our wonderful celebration at KamaSushi. Most pleasant dining experience as always....oh and thanks Roku we love yah

Nick and Sylvia Dallas 

Oh suggestion to readers please highly  recommend Kama Shrimp one of Roku's first suggestions and we are addicted!!!!!!
author: Nick N Sylvia D.

description: I've had a couple of not so great experiences at Kama recently, but still go there so am downgrading to a '3'.  Recently I had dinner there and I ordered toro.  It was NOT fresh- I had to send it back.  The waitered at first argued with me which was so annoying.  They he tried the second piece (kinda gross) and said he agreed and was sorry.  I always think you won't get perfect service anywhere but they are not a 5 anymore!
author: Anne E.

description:
Not impressed.  When this place opened I thought it might be a good cheaper alternate to my favorite neighborhood sushi place (Tataki).  Fail.  I won't be back.

The ambiance is better than the previous restaurant.  However, the menu isn't very interesting, and is overpriced for what it is.  I'm ok with boring, non-offensive sushi if it is CHEAP.  This isn't.  I'd rather spend a little bit more and get GOOD sushi.

The fish didn't taste fresh, the sauces were flavorless (one role came with a lemon ponzu sauce that sounded really exciting... but it was just bland).

Skip it, there's many other better options nearby.
author: Kathryn M.

description: The food is fair, not the worst we've had, but far from the best. We wanted to "love" this place but before our food was even delivered we knew need at best we might "like" it. Let us start by saying that delivery took OVER 1.5 hours....when we phoned to inquire we got the "I think it's on it's way." Ya, think? How about you find out so you can tell me for sure. When our food finally arrives we are starved so normally that would make food taste BETTER than it is....but no. First off one of our rolls did not have snow crab as indicated on the menu. It had that fake dyed pink imitation crap....so that's a strike for false advertising, making a mistake or forgetting to tell us you were out. Nothing else is worth mentioning...just disappointing. If you want good sushi go to Ichi, Saru or Tataki. This place won't last.
author: Romeo And Lola K.

description: Check-in offers and Yelp Deals abound! We had a $20-for-$10 Yelp deal and both my date and I checked in and got a free hot sake check-in deal. Added to that a chirashi don and sashimi platter for a grand total of $20. Would eat again.
author: Adam D.

description: THEY DELIVER! AWESOME! makes for a great light dinner when you don't want to cook. and the food was good. :) i'm excited that a new kid has moved in, which has expanded our good delivery options from just mission chinese food and patxis.
author: susie w.

description: The veggie rolls are amazing (I'm not even a vegetarian), especially the tempura sweet potato with grilled eggplant on top.
author: Mike D.

description: The tuna on my sushi roll was not very fresh. The meat in the katsu don was dry and not very tender. The ramen was passable for a general japanese restaurant (non-ramen joint) ramen. This place is right by home, but I would go out of my way to go somewhere else next time I feel like japanese.
author: Franco C.

description: Deep fried sweet potato rolls & the succulent salmon keep me coming back to Kama. The rolls were filling and delicious! The salmon was so juicy and moist it was orgasmic! The fish was perfectly cooked and had the best flavor to it. The location was also nice and in a quiet neighborhood which was good for my chill mood. Service was good. The dessert lacked but the meal made up for it for sure! Dessert was deep fried ice cream with chocolate drizzles. The ice cream lacked in a nice strong green tea flavor and also the coating was not done well. The free sake check in offer was nice. All in all it was a really good meal and I will be back to feast again!
author: Honey B.

description: Delicious Happy Hour, incredible value. Try the Kama Hama & Walu.
author: Benjamin R.

description: First time here placed a to go order very nice decor fresh and delicious I got the mango tango which was super tasty and spicy tuna roll it's a little pricey but good
author: lyn m.

description: Too lazy to write a full review, so lets just say... bland.  Also incredibly small portions.  Not worth a return trip.
author: Brendan B.

description: Quiet, reasonably priced and staffed by friendly people, this is a spot I would frequent if I lived in the neighborhood.  The food is decent, if not fantastic, but for a quick dinner it is definitely worth stopping by - especially for happy hour.
author: Josh Q.

description: Friendly staff and a solid Happy Hour menu.  It's a great neighborhood sushi place with a delicious ramen bowl.
author: Elham A.

description: Cool place, nice atmosphere, very friendly waitresses... Great Happy Hour Menu and sooo yummy.
author: Daniela B.

description: Had a wonderful experience here with a small group of friends. The presentation of the sushi was classy and we took advantage of the sake deal with a Yelp check-in -- awesome! Roku, our waiter, was the perfect blend of an attentive host and very personable. I never went to the sushi restaurant in this same location before, but I'll definitely be coming back to Kama.
author: Cristina M.

description: Huge menu selection. If you're looking for a decent ramen in Noe Valley, this is the place to go.
author: Laurent T.

description: Hot mama is awesome! The tastiest sushi ever!
author: Bryan E.

description: I went here and used the yelp review. They were busy for dinner, so make a reservation!. Even though they were busy we were seated and served quickly. There was a deal where if you "check in" you get a free small saki. Great service great food. I dont remember all the rolls we tried but the fried green tea ice cream was sooo good.
author: Ana D.

description: The tobiko sushi special is delicious and the service is fantastic. This is a must try if you're in the area. Also, you have to ask for Roku to make you one of his desserts.
author: Andrew M.

description: Kama Sushi's Yelp deal looked attractive, and I had a chance to try it out today. I found the deal great because "Chirashi sushi" was fresh and beautiful, and "Dragon Balls", which was a deep fried tuna roll, was quite interesting. Good value!
author: Nick O.

description: After searching for any restaurant in the calibre of Kiji that actually delivers in our neighborhood, we finally hit the  jackpot with this restaurant.  The food is delicious, innovative and fresh.  It didn't take the changing of the moons to get to our door, either.
author: R R.

description: Went for lunch to catch up with a close friend I hadn't seen in years. The service was the best, with great recommendations from the Roku the host. We ended up ordering a bento box, some rolls and small plates. A large Saporo, some warm sake, and we were happy as clams. They even stayed open past lunch service so we could keep chatting. Will go here again and again.
author: Matt T.

description: I love the food here. It is anything but generic. Their specialty rolls are fantastic, spicy tuna, mama and papa, terrific. The worst dish I had their was average: soft shell crab. Everything else is great. Highly recommend.
author: Samantha S.

description: I've been to Kama twice and gotten delivery once.  On both visits, I found them super friendly and attentive.  Free edamame when you dine in!  The food was tasty and reasonably priced.  I am particularly a fan of the tonkatsu ramen in pork broth.  but i've also tried rolls which were good too.  For a neighborhood joint, it has a pleasant ambience.  Am definitely going back!
author: cherie y.

description: Kama Sushi was great! We got there for dinner without a reservation and they were able to seat us right away - we had our dog tied up outside and they gave us the table by the window so we could watch him. The staff was super nice and eager to tell us what they liked on the menu best. We chose "chef's choice" for our last roll and it did not disappoint! One of the selling factors for us though was that they took water out to our dog, without us having asked, and kept going out to play with him. So sweet!!
author: Simona M.

description: We tried a "yelp" coupon at this place last week and it was pretty good.  I'm not used to places that close for two or three hours between lunch and dinner, so the timing wasn't right, but the food was good.  The happy hour menu was not too much of a savings over the normal sushi menu, but the eggplant appetizer was really a generous serving and I loved the sauce it came with.  The sushi was pretty fresh, but not spectacular.  The sushi chefs looked to be in their teens.  This is a learned art!  But the prices were fair and the service was great.  I'd go again!
author: Katie M.

description: The decor is a little too busy compared to Amberjack, but it's substantially the same offering, I'm happy to say. Neighborhood fan!
author: Dave H.

description:
I live right up the street so I was excited to stop in and see what Kama had to offer.  We experienced nice atmosphere and friendly service and an overall ok experience.

The fish was fresh and tasty but I can't give them more than 3 stars because their menu is BORING!  If you only desire the sushi basics you'd be happy here, but if you're used to any of the other popular SF sushi spots (Blowfish, Sushi Zone, etc) you will be disappointed.

Kama needs to add 4-6 "signature" rolls to help round out their menu.  If they did that, I'd come back, otherwise I see no point to go spend money eating things like "rock n roll" and "spicy tuna" that I can get anywhere.
author: R S.

description: I only tried the sashimi here and was pleasantly surprised that it was very fresh and quite delicious. Service was very friendly. Don't forget to make use of the hot sake for check-in1
author: Oleksandr S.

description: OK, so the first couple of times we went here, we were disappointed. But it was also during the first two weeks that Kama was open, and they were trying to figure a few things out, like good service and memorable food. We live only a short walk away, so we wanted Kama to be as good as Amberjack was - which was solid sushi served in an operating room ambiance. So, determined to keep hope alive, we went back on Friday night (9/23). The service was awesome and so was the miso soup, the shrimp tempura and the variety of rolls that we ordered. And the updated atmosphere helps provide a hip vibe. Hopefully, they have really worked through the initial kinks and will continue to deliver what the neighborhood wants - good sushi at a fair price.
author: Peter R.

description: I work in the neighborhood, and find their sushi is reliably fresh and tasty, and generously portioned. Great lunch specials and happy hour specials as well.
author: JD M.

description:
I love coming to Kama! I love the food! I love the ambiance. What else can I say more? 

Staffs are very attentive and polite. Rolls are creative and have good proportions between rice, seaweed, and fish. 

Must try Mango Tango, Cannon, Crunchy Lobster, and Tonkatsu Ramen! They are to die for!!
author: Linda F.

description:
I got the Yelp $20 for $10 deal, so we weren't expecting too much. BTW, no problems using the Yelp coupon.

To our delight, the service was great (we were the first ones in the restaurant shortly before 6 pm on a weeknight), food was tasty (although some of the rolls could have been larger), and the place filled up by the time we left (right before 7 pm). The bento boxes are filling - didn't fancy the squid teriyaki, which was kind of dry.
author: Jon F.

description: It's my favorite weeknight sushi spot. Portions, price, and quality are better than every other sushi place I've tried in San Francisco.
author: Alexander S.

description: 45 mins for ramen? Waited an hour for a roll that was never made because they had "too many to go orders"? Waited 45 mins to have water refilled? Well folks, if you want Kama sushi, as the waitress explained to me, go ahead and use the phone, don't bother coming in.
author: Bryan R.

description: I happen to be in the neighborhood and really enjoyed dinner here at Kama. Their menu is simple, so don't expect anything out of the ordinary BUT I rather go to a restaurant with few items they can do well than one with an extensive menu with lots of crap they can't do.  The staff recommended the monkfish liver and the Kama Kama, which is the fish head.  I'm usually not a fan of neither because those are usually very fishy, but they were surprisingly pleasant. I'm still not a fan but that's just me.  I liked their nabeyaki udon, the hot mama roll, and dragon roll. All very well prepared.  Their unagi was also excellent.  This is a simple restaurant that delivers good quality food.
author: R A.

description: An average rating of 4 stars? Really? Come on people. I'm a seasoned sushi eater and this really fell short. My baseline for any new sushi restaurant is their California Roll. How basic is that? Their California roll was ooey gooey mayonnaisey with almost a "supermarket sushi" flavor. Then, let's talk about the Mango Tango. Yes, it was very light and fresh. But $7.95 for 4 pieces of sushi? No. This price is not justified and they should have put that detail on their GrubHub menu (or maybe I just missed it). The miso soup was good so I'm giving them 2 stars for the miso and pretty speedy delivery. Unfortunately I will not be going back. Too many other options. After reading more Yelp reviews I'm convinced everyone must be sake-happy when eating there. So disappointing.
author: Kathy G.

description:
They left a flyer at my house for there delivery service, I wish they delivered it somewhere else.  
  Just had their delivery, service was prompt, the food was not good.  Tempura asparagus was fine but not worth seven dollars for un breaded fried asparagus.  The C27 was mayonnaise and a little fishy.  Went out on a limb, and ordered the Hot Papa which is a baked roll... terrible.  Cheese should not be on sushi.  What is advertised as crab stick, is fake crab.  No problem, after I realized it was listed on the menu a crab stick, not crab, obviously my mistake, but why in SF would you use fake crab.  The one truly terrible piece was the Tobiko Sushi Special,  listed as three types of Tobiko.  What they meant was, Tobiko, and two disgusting artificially flavored Tobikos.  
  The coup de grace, was we used the coupon on their flyer for free Dragon Balls.. which didn't show up.  All of this put together would be about a 2.5 star, but with a $60 price tag. No Way!  There is great sushi in this town, don't waste your time.
author: Theodore G.

description: I love this place. Food is fairly priced, great menu and lovely staff. It usually is very busy on the weekends, and I've only had one (out of like 10+) time where the staff was lagging. They do make a great effort with customer service though, so I will give them 5 stars!
author: William M.

description:
big serving sizes
poorly cut sashimi
mediocre ingredients
friendly service
nasty Uni
author: Eric K.

description: Great atmosphere, and very enthusiastic and attentive staff. We called in and ordered our delicious Mango Tango and Crunchy Lobster to-go! Only complaint, is that the hostess who answered the phone, was a little distracted and confused about the ingredients in our Mango Tango. Also, Host expressed to us a little about the people who come in and it is veryy family friendly, enjoy the freedom to bring your toddlers and introduce them to the delicate taste of nori, pickled ginger, and soy sauce! (Mango Tango, is wrapped in cucumber and without rice; though I highly recommend! Great, great, simple, and fresh sushi option, for those with sweet teeth! ;) Kama Sushi, you've done us well! Thank you!
author: Jillian D.

description: Love love LOVE this neighborhood sushi joint.  The happy hour menu is awesome (be sure to order before 6:30 p.m.) and the Yelppies should not miss the free small sake with check in.
author: Donna B.

description: Stopped in to try this new place for their happy hour.  Great, fresh simple rolls to choose from, very nice service.  Don't think they are breaking any ground on rolls here, but a solid choice for basics at a nice price.
author: e w.

description: They removed the flat screen televisions!  I think there's just one small one now.  Yay!
author: Stephanie S.

description: This is BY FAR the WORST sushi experience I have had to go through. I ordered the salmon sushi and received mine after about 20 minutes, but I was in a group of 4 and I'm not going to eat in front of my friends when they haven't been served anything yet, aren't restaurants supposed to bring out everyone's food at once to avoid this issue?  Then, no kidding, we waited another 40 minutes for everyone else to get the roll they ordered because they literally forgot about us. I asked our waiter after 45 minutes of us waiting and he informed me that the kitchen actually forgot about our table, are you serious? They weren't even that busy! In the time we were waiting for our food, an older couple came in, ordered, ate, paid, and left. Then when we finally received and ate our sub-par sushi, we gave clear directions on how we wanted to split the check and they messed that up too, taking another 15 minutes to fix their mistake. Then the waiter has the NERVE to tell me, "Oh, you don't have to tip, this has all been a mess" Oh, trust me buddy, you are not getting a penny above what we owe you. They didn't even comp anything! We were there for an hour and a half due to their careless mistakes, and not even a free bowl of green tea ice cream, really? Maybe it's because we were all clearly college students and we weren't "mature enough" to know good service and sushi from bad, but I'll tell you what, I have been eating sushi since I was 3 years old and this was crap. Don't come here, there are hundreds of other places in the city.
author: Sara H.

description: Very fresh, creative preparations.  very good service.  A hidden gem.
author: Chuck D.

description: Tried this neighborhood place tonight and was impressed.  Had some sushi, rolls, and....Ramen?! They were all great, but I was especially impressed they were able to put together a good bowl of ramen....BRAVO!
author: Roland W.

description: Went for happy hour.... Service was great, but the sushi was not good and some of their rolls were definitely not good combos (such as the Hot Papa).  The cooked food is okay, had the yakitori, but for sushi, I will not be coming here again.  We had sake, walu, and hamachi nigiri, tuna poki, and a spicy tuna roll, and most of it didn't taste right, especially the walu.  Spent $50 and spent the rest of the night trying to get the fishy taste out of my mouth.  Guess this is what I get for cheating on Tataki South and Saru...
author: Maryann G.

description: Terrific neighborhood spot with great sushi. Both great atmosphere and family friendly. We are regulars, both eat-in and for take-out.
author: Kathy R.

description: I don't know why I have ordered from here as many times as I have.  The sushi is subpar, and the portions are ridiculous- 8.95 for 3 small squid legs?  Seriously?  It came, and I literally laughed- maybe it's good for dining in, but for delivery, this place is a joke.
author: T G.

description: Grossly overpriced. The sushi & service were good, but they have the smallest portion size sushi we've ever had ANYWHERE (& we've had a lot of sushi!). This is recent (Oct 2012) -- their portions used to be bigger, but they've reinterpreted "Happy Hour" to mean making miniscule portions at lower prices rather than special prices to get people in early. Not OK. We won't be going back (we miss Amberjack!...).
author: Kate W.

description: Truly disgusting sushi. The fish on the rainbow roll smelled so fishy that I threw it out.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Kama isn't really new but it's sorta new and a couple weeks ago my roommate and I tried it out, after failing to get into the newest new sushi place the night before. Sunday evening and we were seated right away, to a cool covered booth. I got two different sushi rolls (mango tango and autumn) plus seaweed salad. He got two (rainbow, and one big volcano type one) plus the seafood udon. My food was tiny. Somehow, I managed to order the two most tiniest rolls in the place. I'll admit, I was still hungry. They were good..the mango one was a little sweet for me, but both were tasty. But just way too small. My roommate's rolls were large. Add that to the soup, which came in a very cool giant spoon bowl, and he had a lot more to eat than me, so he graciously shared. His rolls were tastier than mine. So beware, you may get a lot of food, or you may get enough to just feed a child. The seafood udon had a lot of noodles, but the broth was bland and only had about two pieces of seafood. He wanted me to make sure to note that in the review. Because neither of us were stuffed, we tried the mocha lover - green tea, coffee and mango ice cream wrapped in mocha. This was really yummy especially the coffee one. The service was good to start, friendly, but by the end, they forgot about us over there in our cool covered booth, so much so that while we were trying to get our bill, a guy came over with waters and asked if we wanted to order..he thought we were brand new people! LOL. Overall, it was good, not great, but maybe just needs some tweaks of improvement still. I would certainly return, but hope to gamble to order some more substantial food.  It was A-OK! Oh, and i may add, the price was much better (cheaper) than what we would have paid had we been able to get into that other sushi place the night before, so bonus!
author: Merredith L.

description: Kama sushi on Church in Noe Valley is one of those places that I really want to love. It's in a great location, the service is good and so is the atmosphere. But the food is just okay. The edamame they serve (complimentary, which is nice) is blah. No flavor and I always wonder if they got a good deal on it.  Last time, I had one of the less expensive rolls and was underwhelmed.  I figured, well I got what I paid for. But this time I ordered their signature roll, the crunchy lobster roll at $14.95. I had high hopes.  But it was just okay. There was so much tempura on it that it was hard to find the roll!  Then, I tasted the sauce more than the sushi.  I was hoping for a flavor explosion.  Not.  On the bright side the miso soup was good and so was the sake. But that's hard to mess up.  Osaka sushi in the Castro is a better option. Itchi sushi in the Mission close to Bernal is awesome. I will check back here in a couple months and see if they made it any better. With high hopes and thanks for reading.
author: Ross C.

description: Absolutely delicious salmon sashimi.  Solid, if not deeply flavorful, chicken vegetable udon soup.  Slightly lackadaisical service -- had to ask for tea three times before it arrived, but overall pleasant.  Great atmosphere, though a bit loud -- it was completely full at 7:00 pm, midweek.
author: Taly J.

description: I normally am a fan of what some would call "white girl sushi".  You know the type: cali rolls, anything with spicy mayo and deep fried.  Since being forced to go gluten free, my sushi experiences have been pretty limited.  I can't have soy sauce, anything fried, or imitation krab.  The waitstaff at Kama Sushi was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and was able to tell us exactly what we could and couldn't have.  They didn't offer tamari, but luckily we brought our own packets just in case.     We ended up getting the rainbow shrimp (grilled shrimp wrapped in bacon, $6.95), negi hana roll ($5.95), spicy scallop roll ($5.95), and Boston roll ($5.95).  It ended up being just enough food for two mildly hungry people and we enjoyed all the items.  The star of the show was the rainbow shrimp- but that's not all that fair to the others because how can anything really compete with bacon?
author: Cersei T.

description: My date and I spent $60 with drinks for a fast. Sushi rice was too sticky and dense for my taste. Fish was average. Grilled kama fish was very good. A unique dish! Raman was tasty too. Service was ok. Slow at times. The place is cozy but can be loud.
author: Daniel L.

description: While the ambiance and decor is much improved over it's predecessor, Amberjack Sushi, the sushi is about the same...nothing to mind-shattering, but still good.  The staff is attentive and quick to check in on serving up more beer or sake (yay!) and refilling water...restaurant water is so much better than at home for some reason.  My big negative is that they have 2 TVs constantly on, usually with sports.  Although the volume is muted, it is a big thumbs down for me that so many places give in to sports fans need to constantly be entertained by overpaid "icons" playing games.  I prefer my nights out to be spent enjoying the company of my companions, distraction free.  Aside from that, the seafood salad and seafood ceviche are great places to start off any meal, and walu (butterfish) negiri is always my dessert.  Yum!
author: Lew D.

description: Great sushi.  I appreciate that they do not overload their sushi with sauce, so you can actually taste the sushi.  New favorite place.
author: Eric S.

description: Food was not sushi grade at all, it was very tough and didn't taste fresh at all.
author: John K.

description: The decor is nice and the staff is very friendly.  Had to sit at the counter because it was full when I arrived, but I got to watch the sushi chef put my dish together.  I ordered the Sushi Deluxe dinner, which includes a roll and chef's choice sashimi and nigiri - a good value and fills you up, which is rare for a sushi place at that price.  Even with a crowded dining room, I didn't have to wait long.  The light salt on the endamame beans is a nice touch.  The waiter knew a lot about sake, letting us taste different "brews," which I found interesting.
author: Jim O.

description: If you're veggie oriented, love Japanese food, and go for sushi, Kama Sushi is the place for you.  Lovely service and wonderful food--I'll be back in a heartbeat.
author: Toni N.

description: My friends keep telling me good thing about this place,finally got to try last night, very fresh and testy sushi, must try their uni, reasonable price, definly will go back
author: JUNE Z.

description: went there with friends and all of us love this place~! their food was goooooood  and the service was excellent. you should try it out~!!!
author: SauPin K.
